import.name: Coring War Hammer
import.description:
A giant hammer than when it strikes, can create a 10 block pillar. Creating the pillar is up to the wielder and you must be attuned to are war hammer.

If a creature is struck and a pillar made, the creature must pass a dexterity check against the damage dealt, or be raised on the pillar.

If the pillar hits a ceiling, any creature on the pillar takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage.

The pillar is always perpendicular to the ground where it originated.

The strain of rushing drains you however, and you can only use this 2 times per long rest.

import.name: scribbled notes
import.description: What appear to be research notes from the Idoru Academy.
import.note:
Notes are in Ancient; Draconic, Deep Speech, Primordial, and Celestial make it generally understandable.

Informs the reader of the names of the types of crystals.

The Citizen - Blue
The Crafter - Green
The Composer - Orange
The Curator - Red

The Conformist - Lime

Little is known of the Gold & Silver crystals, they are the only known stable results of combining crystals, but the exact conditions for combining the crystals seem incidental and inconsistent.

import.name: Encyclopedia Collection from Idoru Academy
import.description: What appear to be a collection of encyclopedias from the Idoru Academy.
import.note:
Notes are in Ancient; Draconic, Deep Speech, Primordial, and Celestial make it generally understandable.

These encyclopedias contain information on various topics and concerns of magic, helping clarify some points of how magic works at a fundamental level, but will take decades to understand.

Once understood, some basic things that can be determined;

+ Provides instructions for Crystal liquification

These notes describe how to grow a crystal and creating a basic vial, which involves melting down a crystal with acid, force, and fire elements, then dividing the crystal pieces into a vial and describes how a host can grow a crystal and the effects were excessive growing can be hazzardous to the health.

Also noting that Gold and Silver crystals are still not entirely understood and do not appear to observe the same properties.

+ (Requires Large Crystal Refining) - Flight with crystals
+ (Requires Large Crystal Refining) - Larger force fields for protecting cities or boats with crystals
 
+ Improved spell casting (From level higher cast per day with a crystal in inventory)

+ With 2 other Ancient sets, can learn Ancient with 100 hours of reading with 3 sets.

import.description:

import.name: Panlosi

The Pantheric Spear

A two handed spear that pulses with the spirit of a panther. Swift and hidden while striking, can not be thrown but grants advantage on attacks made with the spear.

import.note:
Spear of the Panther
- Catalan:pantera & Zulu:ilihlosi

import.name: Spear Sling
import.description:
While equipped, you may have 6 spears readied to be equipped or thrown.

If your currently equipped weapon is a spear or javelin, you can place it in the sling if changing weapons. Otherwise you must drop your current weapons or spend an action putting your current weapons away.

If you are merely throwing a spear or javelin from this sling, the attack uses an action as normal, or bonus action if some effect is allowing you to attack with a bonus action.

This sling replaces your usual "12 studs" of readied weaponry, where a spear or javelin normally count as 4 to 5 studs in size each.

import.name: Readied Spear Sling
import.description:
While equipped, you may have 6 spears readied to be equipped or thrown. These spears are kept more ready than usual through magical enchantments once the sling is attuned to you, allowing you to throw to attack as an action or bonus action.

If your currently equipped weapon is a spear or javelin, you can place it in the sling if changing weapons. Otherwise you must drop your current weapons or spend an action putting your current weapons away.

Due to the enchantment, you may throw a spear or javelin from this sling to attack as an action or a bonus action.

This sling replaces your usual "12 studs" of readied weaponry, where a spear or javelin normally count as 4 to 5 studs in size each.

This sling does not let you attack normally with your bonus action.
import.hiddenDescription: A spear sling whose pouch has a faint white glow.

import.name: Plant
import.description: A branch with a few leaves from a plant.
import.note: These are actually poisonous and unknown to the player

import.name: War Helmet
import.description: A heavy iron helmet that offers protection without impairing the view.

import.name: Wizard's Hat
import.description: A minor enchantment makes the wearer slightly more intelligent.

import.name: Simple Wizard Hat
import.description: A simple hat shaped like a wizard's hat.

import.name: Sorarusaru
import.description: While arcane energy flows out from the mace, animals seem a bit skittish around you from the arcane pressence.
import.hiddenDescription: A runic embroidery surrounds the mace's head.
import.note:
This mace also remembers your dreams, nightmares the previous night will decrease your wisdom, and good dreams will increase your wisdom.

Every long rest, roll a percentile. On a 30 or less, a nightmare occurs. On a 70 or higher, a good dream occurs.

+ Somni (Draconic:Dream)
+ Rursus (Common:Back)

import.name: Empty Potion Flask
import.description: An empty potion flask

import.name: Young Wyvern Skin
import.description: 1 square stud of wyvern skin

import.name: Magical Cat Horn
import.description: The horn from a cat like creature that has faint magical essence.

import.name: Skeletal Remains
import.description: Collection of skeletal remains
import.note: Has to be broken up to be put in a bag

import.name: Encyclopedia Collection from Aixer
import.description: What appear to be a collection of encyclopedias from the Aixer Tomb.
import.note:
Notes are in Ancient; Draconic, Deep Speech, Primordial, and Celestial make it generally understandable.

These encyclopedias contain information on various topics and concerns of magic, helping clarify some points of how magic works at a fundamental level, but will take decades to understand.

+ Provides instructions for Large Crystal Assembly

These notes describe how to create a large crystal by melting them down and then applying pressure with force magic to hold it together while using cold magic to resolidify it.

Also noting that Gold and Silver crystals are still not entirely understood and do not appear to observe the same properties.

+ (Requires Crystal Liquification) - Imbue a weapon with crystal properties
+ (Requires Crystal Levitation) - Weightless Items

+ Improved skill checks while holding a crystal of the correct alignment.

+ With 2 other Ancient sets, can learn Ancient with 100 hours of reading with 3 sets.

import.name: Pillow And Blanket
import.description:
A pillow and blanket for comfy rests.

Can use a charge to make a constitution save against the Pillow's DC to have a 6 to 8 hour long rest instead of an 8 to 10 hour rest.

import.name: Oil Can
import.description: A simple reusable oil can with 1 square stud of contents.

import.name: Caltrops
import.description:
A handful of small spiky balls that can be tossed across the ground.

Makes the terrain cause damage if a creature moves through it at full speed, caused 1 piercing damage per stud.

Each unit of caltrops is enough to cover 1 stud.

import.name: Mug
import.description: A simple mug

import.name: Keg
import.description: A reusable keg for liquids.

import.name: Scarf
import.description:
A simple scarf for warmth or decoration.

May cause overheating if worn in warmer areas.

import.name: Candle
import.description: 1 Candle

import.name: Ration
import.description: A basic field ration. Lasts for awhile without going bad, but not quite satisfying.

import.name: Healing Potion (depre2)
import.description: Possess magical properties from it's brewing that heal the creature that consumes the liquid.

import.name: Symbol of Athena
import.description:
A necklace with the inscriptions of Athena's blessing

"With my power and wisdom, may you find a path to right the wrongs of the world."

import.name: Wamusa
import.description: A light dagger with a red glow, seems to improve your reflexes slightly and grants firebolt as a spell.
import.hiddenDescription: The dagger gives off a low red glow, also seems good for throwing.

import.name: Sinifiji
import.description: A light dagger with a blue glow, seems to improve your reflexes slightly. When casting a Cantrip, you may cast through this wand adding the wand's damage to the spell. The additional damage hits or misses with the Cantrip. Additionally, you know the spell Ball Lightning and can use a charge may be used to cast that spell or you may use a charge as a reaction to deflect and ground all incoming Lightning damage, causing you to take ${0,orange}$ damage of that type.
import.hiddenDescription: The wand is warm to the touch but seems rather plain otherwise.
import.note:
Tracking Notes

Previous Action Map:
{
    "action": [],
    "bonusAction": [],
    "reaction": []
}

import.name: Empowering Charm
import.description: A small charm to put around your waist.

import.name: Aiming Charm
import.description: A small charm to put around your waist.

import.name: Potion of Owl's Intellect
import.description:
A potion that grants +1 wisdom for 1 hour.

You gain "Owl's Intelligence" effect.

import.name: Potion of Crow's Wisdom
import.description:
A potion that grants +1 wisdom for 1 hour.

You gain "Crow's Wisdom" effect.

import.name: Orla's Tailisman
import.description: Orla's personal talisman that helps her to channel magic.

import.name: Draconic Gold Pouch
import.description:
A bag of holding strictly for gold.

Can contain up to 20,000 Gold.

Specially enchanted to keep the gold weightless and hold an almost infinite amount.

Given to everyone in Draconia who is born there, but costly to replace.
import.note: Mini-loop to negate carrying gold, but interesting plot point for citizens of Draconia.

import.name: Spellbook
import.description: A simple spellbook for holding spells.

import.name: Bonewolf Tail
import.description: The spiny tail of a bone wolf.

import.name: Bonewolf Horn
import.description: The bone horns of a bone wolf.

import.name: Bonewolf Pelt
import.description: A 1 stud x 1 stud of bone wolf pelt.

import.name: Gisengard Corpse
import.description: Corpse of a Gisengard lightly glowing white
import.note: Still magical

import.name: Gisengard Corpse
import.description: Corpse of a Gisengard with no glow.
import.note: No magical effect.

import.name: Gisengard Corpse
import.description:
Corpse of a Gisengard lightly glowing white.

Three legs have been descaled.

Torso, tail, head, and a leg remain.
import.note: Still magical

import.name: Keg of Mqusi Beer
import.description: Keg of Mqusi beer

import.name: Aiming Charm
import.description: A small charm to put around your waist.

import.name: Empowering Charm
import.description: A small charm to put around your waist.

import.name: Thunderous Trident
import.description: A spear with a three point head

import.name: Bag of Medeillomo
import.description:
Medeillomo is a magical bag of holding that happily announces itself to its commandant.

He is a magical bag of holding with a fairly large maximum weight and size of storage.

Will maintain a watchful eye on your items, announcing if anything unwanted picks at them.

Also while buying things, will comment as he sees fit. And while many of his comments may be unwanted, he will occasionally identify items.
import.hiddenDescription:
Eleven:
Medeis (Magic)
umlomo (Mouth)
import.note:
Investigation Check to discover his secrets; DC: 21

Unbenounced to the owner, Medillomo will occasionally consume gold as a "charge" for his services.

Also occasionally mis-identifies the safety of items.

import.name: Ipse Doll
import.description:
Commonly known now as the "Doll of Self" in modern myth, the doll takes the form of a miniature version of the person holding it.

While you feel where and how you are holding the doll, the doll also reveals magical effects on you with various colors and magical effects when examined.

Though some things shown are hard to see, an investigation check is needed to make out all the effects, and some effects may be hidden by other magics.

The doll requires no attunement and will reflect whoever is holding it after 1 minute (10 rounds).
import.hiddenDescription:
Common:
Self (Ipse | Latin)
import.note:
Occasionally other effects are shown on the doll as an effect of the user's disposition, so panic may show as another effect similar to a charm spell and be hard to discern.

On investigating the doll, a critical fail results in a curse as your eyes get lost in the magical effects fluttering around the doll.

The creature that failed gains the effect "Egotistical" and has a disadvantage on all charisma related checks and saves until their next long rest.

import.name: Compass of Ambition
import.description:
Points to that which you most desire.

When waking from a long rest, name the desired creature or item.
import.hiddenDescription: A seemingly broken compass that appears to be spinning and randomly pointing in various directions.
import.note:
Takes a percentile check after a long rest;

00 - 10: Curse of desire, points toward nearby dangerous creatures.
11 - 20: Roll 1d8, points in that cardinal direction permanently.
21 - 100: If an creature or object was named completely and correctly, points towards the object requested by the player.

The desired thing must be in this plane of existence for the compass to point at it.

However, if a portal is opened to the needed plane of existence, will point to the portal.

import.name: Blessed Dream Rose
import.description:
When acquiring the rose, must past a wisdom save (DC:18) or become irrevocably attached to possessing the rose. After becoming attached to it, can attempt to drop or giving it away once per long rest against another wisdom check (DC:21).

When sleeping, you always dream and the rose is always present in your dreams. Sometimes good, sometimes bad. You roll a percentile every long rest.
import.hiddenDescription: A radiant rose, with many spines along its stem.
import.note:
The blessing of on the rose is from Zeus. His choatic neutral nature showing in how the rose manifests its effects against the one bound to it.

The effect of the rose, varies;

00 - 10: Chaotic Effect
11 - 30: Mallidiction Effect
31 - 60: Neutral Effect
61 - 90: Beneficial Effect
91 - 100: Lawful Effect

import.name: Fucott's Scryglass
import.description:
A spy glass with a range of 800 studs to see clearly, and an additional 200 studs decent vision where you can see but have a disadvantage on any skill checks done through the spyglass.

When looking through the Scryglass, speak the command word to mark a creature in your view, immediately consuming a charge. You must keep the target in view of the Scryglass for 30 seconds (5 rounds). If the target is lost, the charge is stilled consumed.

For the next 10 days you may use this to scry on the marked creature.

Losing attunement clears the mark against that creature.

A perception check may allow the creature to know it has been marked, but it must have an intelligence of 6 or greater to be able to notice.

Scry is subject to the usual possibility of being resisted or spotted based on the item's indicated DC.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate spyglass that seems to have magnificent zoom.
import.note:
The command word is "Fuck You" and when spoken has a chance to offend anyone in listening range, possibly provoking an attack against the person using the item.

Can only provoke 1 person into an actual attack.

Everyone provoked must pass a wisdom save against the item's DC or be forced to attack the user at least once, lasting for 6 rounds. If the target for the provoked is unreachable, the provoked screams and yell while trying to lunge, jump, or escape any confides.

The provoked will also ignore all threatening barriers, such as damaging terrain, cliffs, etc. But will attempt to navigate them if acceptable, ie. achievable within the remaining time.

import.name: Potion of Dissolution
import.description:
Can use a charge to dissolve an item of up to a size of 2 cubic studs. This includes corpses and rocks. Living flesh is however fairly resilient and enchanted items and clothing will essentially provide immunity to this potion.

Can use multiple charges at a time to dissolve larger objects.

The liquid, even if the vial is fully emptied, will regenerate slowly when you rest.
import.hiddenDescription: A mystical looking black and deep blue liquid swirl in the potion vial.
import.note:
There is no good way to cork this liquid and it will slowly occasionally dissolve small items in your inventory.

If it's in a bag of holding, it only effects items in the bag of holding, but will not effect itself.

If put away with no cork, stil regenerates but will spill out and immediately consume a portion of the inventory.

import.name: Potion of Lucidity
import.hiddenDescription: A mystical looking bright green liquid swirling in the potion vial.
import.note:
On a critical fail of the check, the effect "Damnation of Aevum" is received instead.

On a natural 20, the effect "Blessing of Aevum" is received, the time duration effect is applied but there is no Spell DC penalty.

import.name: Aura Lense
import.description: When looking through the spyglass, speak the command word to immediately consume a charge, revealing magical effects and allowing to see through illusions.
import.hiddenDescription: A simple spyglass with a yellow lense that does not magnify but gives a yellow tint.
import.note: The command word is "Vidi".

import.name: Aura Lense
import.description:
When looking through the spyglass, speak the command word to immediately consume a charge, revealing magical effects and allowing to see through illusions.

When using a charge, the lense sees magical effects for 1 minute.

Command Word: Vidi
import.hiddenDescription: A simple spyglass with a yellow lense that does not magnify but gives a yellow tint.

import.name: Aura Step
import.description:
Once attuned to Aura Step, speaking it's command word will teleport you to the disk.

Activating the disk takes an action.

If the space is occupied, make a dexterity check at DC:17. If you fail, you take 2d6 bludgeoning damage. On a success, the opposing occupant takes 2d6 instead of you.
import.hiddenDescription: A simple yellow disk with a simple rune in the middle of it.

import.name: Momento
import.description:
Once attuned to Momento, on a successful attack, you can speak the command word and use a charge to attempt to dominate a creature.

The creature makes a strength saving throw, that when failed will obey you for 2 rounds.
import.hiddenDescription: A very ornate mace with a pearly opalescence to it.

import.name: Whisper Coat
import.description: While you get a fairly epic look, it's hard to deceive people since they seem to already expect something from you.
import.hiddenDescription: A leather cloak that seems a bit more flowy in the wind than you'd expect.

import.name: Scimatar
import.description: A dexterous sword

import.name: Keg of Mqusi Beer half empty
import.description: Keg of Mqusi beer

import.name: Divine Blue Power Crystal
import.description: A familiar palm sized crystal with a blue glow but has divine energy coursing through the inside of the crystal.

import.name: Green Crystal Ingot
import.hiddenDescription: A big heavy ingot of what seems to be crystal

import.name: Sverazisa
import.description:
A strong and sharp dwarven dagger at its core, an elven enchantment runs through it.

You may speak the command word to use a charge and teleport to the dagger at anytime (Bonus Action or Reaction) as long as the dagger is further than 5 studs and no further than 100 studs.

If you use it as a reaction, you teleport and roll 1d6 to add to your AC to help protect against the incoming attack.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate silver inlay travels along the blade.

import.name: Swift
import.description:
A simple yet extremely well balanced dagger.

An inscription lay at the base of the hilt reading simply "Swift".

import.name: Kunai
import.description: A small and light weight dagger made with a very strong alloy. Good for stabbing, but great for throwing.

import.name: Deliverance
import.description: While as big as the usual trident, it is much lighter, and the sleek design and special metal make it well suited for throwing.

import.name: Fine Metallic Staff
import.description:
A sleek cold staff with a definitive magical essence to it.

Helps to focus magical attacks.

import.name: Potion of Sleep
import.description:
A potion of sleeping.

When poured or consumed, roll 3d6, if it exceeds the HP of the creature consuming it, it goes to sleep for 1 hour or until it is woken.

import.name: Potion of Greater Sleep
import.description:
A potion of sleeping.

When poured or consumed, roll 12d6, if it exceeds the HP of the creature consuming it, it goes to sleep for 1 hour or until it is woken.

import.name: Rock Snake Scale
import.description: A scale from a rock snake, heavy, but study

import.name: Night Die
import.description:
The Night Die is a fortune telling die that can predict safety during sleep.

When rolled and a charge is used, it foretells what will happen, though reading it may be a bit of a challenge s the language it foretells in can change.

A charge can not be used by someone to which the die is not attuned (Must be equipped to your pouch).

It is easy to know when the foretelling has failed from the extreme headache you will experience, and you can expect nightmares that night.

Can only use 1 charge per day.
import.hiddenDescription: Mysteriously black twelve sided die with no symbols or runes. Each side is merely a smooth black surface.
import.note:
The Night Die is the result of an experiment in divination with the power crystals.

The infusion with the power crystals resulted in the die speaking in ancient, but since the responses are one word, it cycles between Ancients base languages.

import.name: Red Crystal Ingot
import.hiddenDescription: A big heavy ingot of what seems to be crystal

import.name: Blue Crystal Ingot
import.hiddenDescription: A big heavy ingot of what seems to be crystal

import.name: Orange Crystal Ingot
import.hiddenDescription: A big heavy ingot of what seems to be crystal

import.name: Resurrection Ingot
import.description:
A resurrection ingot is enchanted to bring a dead creature back to life.

The effects vary based on the creature, but in general the stone loses its power after use; In many cases disintegrating entirely.
import.hiddenDescription: A big heavy ingot of what seems to be crystal
import.note:
Leverages the alignment of Green.

Very difficult enchantment to create but simple to use once done if you know what it is.

Can also serve as a component in more complex rituals.

import.name: Resurrection Ingot
import.description:
A resurrection ingot is enchanted to bring a dead creature back to life.

The effects vary based on the creature, but in general the stone loses its power after use; In many cases disintegrating entirely.
import.hiddenDescription: A big heavy ingot of what seems to be crystal
import.note:
Leverages the alignment of Green.

Very difficult enchantment to create but simple to use once done if you know what it is.

Can also serve as a component in more complex rituals.

This crystal was meant for the ArchWizard to use for raising the dead in Neulus Re and the litineut in charge, upon realizing the theft, sought out the thieves and lost his battle.

import.name: Crooked Cocky Cane
import.description:
A crooked staff with a magical aura about it. Every time you wake up, roll a percentile; On 20 or less, you are cursed until your next long rest.

Add the effect "Cursed [Stat]" where Stat is your highest stat of Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

import.name: Alchemical Air Condenser
import.description:
A complex and delicate item meant for use with an alchemy kit.

It's design and material make it resistant to the elements such as fire, acid, or poison and many others. These resistances allow it to condense those elements from the air and distil them to something that the alchemy kit can use.

However, using this item adds complexity to the process of using the alchemy kit, the difficulty check (DC) for this item must be rolled along with any alchemy checks.

This item can condense a a general area of elemental air, or 1 spell cast of dragonborn breathe, to 1 unit of usable elemental liquid and consumes 1 charge per use.

The precision of the instrument however makes it only usable against standing terrain or from willing creatures.
import.note: x

import.name: Simple Alchemical Air Condenser
import.description:
A complex and delicate item meant for use with an alchemy kit.

It's design and material make it resistant to the elements such as fire, acid, or poison and many others. These resistances allow it to condense those elements from the air and distil them to something that the alchemy kit can use.

However, using this item adds complexity to the process of using the alchemy kit, the difficulty check (DC) for this item must be rolled along with any alchemy checks.

This item can condense a a general area of elemental air, or 1 spell cast of dragonborn breathe, to 1 unit of usable elemental liquid and consumes 1 charge per use.

The precision of the instrument however makes it only usable against standing terrain or from willing creatures.
import.note: x

import.name: Advanced Alchemical Air Condenser
import.description:
A complex and delicate item meant for use with an alchemy kit.

It's design and material make it resistant to the elements such as fire, acid, or poison and many others. These resistances allow it to condense those elements from the air and distil them to something that the alchemy kit can use.

However, using this item adds complexity to the process of using the alchemy kit, the difficulty check (DC) for this item must be rolled along with any alchemy checks.

This item can condense a a general area of elemental air, or 1 spell cast of dragonborn breathe, to 2 units of usable elemental liquid and consumes 1 charge per use.

The precision of the instrument however makes it only usable against standing terrain or from willing creatures.
import.note: x

import.name: Vial of Elemental Acid
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

import.name: Vial of Elemental Ice
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

import.name: Vial of Elemental Sound
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

However, the nature of the vial seems to be a bit noisy.

import.name: Vial of Elemental Thunder
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

However, the nature of the vial seems to be a bit noisy.

import.name: Skull of a Flame Walker
import.description:
When striking a creature with any weapon while this is equipped to your belt as a charm, you may speak the command word to ignite the infused essence of flame in the skull to deal an additional 1d6 of fire damage with your strike.

On a critical, the damage from thie die roll is doubled with the damage from your weapon.

You may opt to use a charge after you know if you have hit (And this if you have criticaled).

You may also expend any number of charges at once.
import.hiddenDescription: A black, almost charred object that resembles an oddly shaped skull.
import.note:
On use, has a chance to induce a nightmare later that night.

When used, roll percentile and on 25 or less, you will have a nightmare the next time you sleep.

import.name: Orb of Talkuhle
import.description:
Absorbs freshly spilled blood around you. Either from yourself when you are struck or from creatures that have been struck near you.

Note half the damage taken by creatures adjacent to you up to the listed difficulty check (DC) for this item.

If you have this equipped as a charm around your waist, you may speak the command word to the Orb of Talkuhle as a  reaction to create a barrier around you for 10 rounds that absorbs that much damage. Mark the absorbed damage to 0 and add an appropriate number to your temporary health pool.
import.hiddenDescription: A deep almost blood red ball that appears to have a glassy exterior.

import.name: Pillbox (Depre)
import.description:
A box of pills, some of which seem to have gone stale.

Also appears the only way to get one out is one at a time and consume it.
import.note:
Bad tastes give a better effect as the aging has caused the flavor to rot but increased the potency.

Can overdose on the effects however when the potency bonus is in effect.

import.name: Potion of Levitation
import.description:
When consumed, you gain the ability to fly using your normal movement speed.

This effect lasts for 1 hour.

import.name: Potion of Invisibility
import.description: When consumed, you become invisible for 1 hour. Taking any Action will break the invisibility. On taking any damage, you must pass a constitution check who's DC is half the damage taken, or the invisibility falters and fades.

import.name: Potion of Mending
import.description:
Pour on an item to repair it.

Make an intelligence check to determine the extent of the repairs.

Simple repairs will have a lower DC than more complex ones and all mendings may result in a partial repair if the difficulty is not met.

In rare cases (Critical Failures), the mending potion has a caustic effect instead of repairing.

import.name: General Poison Remedy
import.description: When consumed, cures any poison present and makes you immune to poison for 1 round (6 seconds).

import.name: General Petrification Remedy
import.description: When poured on a petrified creature, removes the petrification.

import.name: Third Eye Elixir
import.description:
When consumed, you gain a Third Eye on your forehead until your next long rest.

The eye grants you an additional reaction every round.

Gain the effect "Third Eye".

import.name: Potion of Arcane Recovery
import.description:
You may regain spell slots totaling 3 in level.

For Example:
+ 3 Level 1 Slots
+ 1 Level 1 and 1 Level 2 Slot
+ 1 Level 3 Slot

import.name: Elixir of Morletum
import.description:
For the next 10 minutes you gain the ability to speak to the dead.

Their spirits may not be present for you to speak with if they have been dead too long, or they may be unwilling to speak, but you may ask any willing spirit 1 question.

After answering your question, the spirit will lose interest in you and fade from you vision.

import.name: Elixir of Ospensar
import.description:
When a creature is effected by the elixir, it has no verbal filter for 1 minute and simply speaks whatever it is thinking out loud.

An unwilling or unwitting creature makes a save to resist the effects.
import.note:
Os: Mouth(Common)
Pensar: Think(Draconic)

import.name: Vision Tobaco
import.description: Causes minor hallucinations and gives a warm tingly feeling that many find relaxing.

import.name: Tea Pot
import.description:
Used to brew up to 4 cups of tea.

Can brew with special herbs with some difficulty.

On success, the herbs used to brew with can pass their traits down to the tea.

If you have an alchemist kit, you may perform your DC with your "Alchemist Kit" check instead of against this item itself.

import.name: Healing Potion
import.description: Possess magical properties from it's brewing that heal the creature that consumes the liquid.

import.name: Autus Leaf
import.description:
When consumed or smoked, causes random hair growth for 1d10 days after a long rest.

Also known to blend well into tea.
import.note:
Roll 1d6 to determine what grows:
1. Hair
2. Mustache
3. Beard
4. Chest Hair
5. Pubic Hair
6. Leg Hair

import.name: Sana Leaf
import.description:
When consumed, has a chance to fill your body with healing herbs, causing all healing you receive to gain its maximum effect.

On failure, it has no effect.

On Success, gain the "Sana Leaf" effect.
import.note: Grows in most climates, particular flat lands. Rare in Frozen land and deserts but can be found in those.

import.name: Alupho Leaf
import.description: The Alupho leaf is known to have effects on dreams, occasionally giving the consumer control over their dreams.
import.note:
On success, you decide what you dream of over long rests for the next 1d4 long rests.

On failure, your next 1d6 long rests are guaranteed to be nightmares.

import.name: Scroll of Identity
import.description:
Lay the scroll out and place an item in the circle, then speak the words "Apicem Venificium", old common for "Peak Magic".

On success, the item is revealed to the one who spoke the words while touching the scroll.

Regardless, the runes on the scroll fade leaving a blank scroll.

import.name: Scroll of Magical Dissipation
import.description:
Hold the scroll towards the magical incantation you wish to remove.

On success, the scroll's runic imprint is consumed and the magic in the desired area is dispelled if the magic is of Level ${3,orange}$ or lower.

import.name: Scroll of Fireball
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${3,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, you unleash a magical fireball to be hurled toward target area. The fireball deals ${8d6,darkorange}$ fire damage with a radius of ${int*3,darkorange}$ studs. Outside the inner range, any effected creatures have advantage on their saving throw. On successful save, creatures take half damage.

import.name: Scroll of Iceball
import.description:
Cause a magical iceball to be hurled toward target area. The iceball deals 4d6 cold damage with a radius of 10 studs.

Outside the inner range, any effected creatures have advantage on their saving throw.

On successful save, creatures take half damage.

On failed save, creatures are slowed (Half movement speed) for one round.

import.name: Scroll of Location
import.description:
On successful cast, if the named entity is on the same plane as you and within the inner range, you immediately know its location.

If it is within the outer range, you get a sense of what direction to go, but not how far away it is.

Otherwise nothing happens and the scroll fades.

import.name: Tiny Mechanical Spider
import.description: More the result of tinkering than anything useful, this tiny mechanical spider can be wound up and placed to walk in a straight line seemingly like a spider for a few studs.

import.name: Small Gemstone
import.description: Small clear gemstone.

import.name: Gemstone
import.description: A medium sized clear gemstone.

import.name: Large Gemstone
import.description: A large size clear gemstone.

import.name: Reeds
import.description: several small reeds. Notably hollow in the middle and can act as straws.

import.name: Straw
import.description: A specialty hollowed metal straw, usually for drinking.

import.name: Scroll of Touch
import.description:
Reading the scroll, a creature becomes very sensitive to touch, amplifying pleasure and pain.

If the creature is not willing, it makes a Wisdom saving throw. On success, it is unaffected.

If an affected creature takes damage, it must make a wisdom save against this item's DC or be incapacitated until its turn comes up.

If an affected creature is massaged pleasantly, it must pass a wisdom save against this item's DC or have disadvantage on deception and creature's making insight checks against it have advantage.
import.note: Can make a person more truthful in the right hands.

import.name: Heavy Coat
import.description:
A warm coat that holds off the cold.

Provides the most warm you can receive from clothing alone.

import.name: Spyglass
import.description: A delicate metal casing containing precisely sculpted optical lensing allowing the user to see over vast distances.

import.name: Javelin
import.description:
A javelin, thrown for damage.

Thrown from inventory, does not need a free hand.

import.name: Rusty Javelin
import.description:
A very worn out javelin. Likely only good for a throw or two.

Make a general difficulty check against the item's DC. Failure means the javelin breaks.

import.name: Carrier Scroll
import.description: Write a short message on the scroll and focus on it and it will disintegrate and appear at a predetermined location that is set when the scroll is made.

import.name: Umoya Crystal
import.description: Soul gems are known from old dark magic, little is known about them other than they hold the soul of a dead creature and can be used in alchemical and arcane rituals. With the right Arcana handling, the soul can be released from the gem.
import.hiddenDescription: A violet gem with a low dark glow.
import.note:
Successful arcana check against the gem can release the soul or summon it back into its body if the body is present.

If the gem is empty, it can be used at half it's DC to resurrect a creature who has been dead for less than 1 minute.

import.name: Black Veldr Statue
import.description:
Used to summon a Veldr. Whether it works or not depends on how loyal the Veldr is to you.

If not loyal, the Veldr can be summoned once a day and roll a d10 to see how long it can stay out.

If the Veldr is fully loyal to you, once summoned it can stay out forever and for an action can be returned to its status state.
import.hiddenDescription: A small statue of a black cat with glowing green eyes.
import.note:
Once attuned, every long rest roll a percentile and a d10. On rolling above the current loyalty, the Veldr gains the d20 in loyalty toward you and you can summon it that day.

If you roll a percentile below it's loyalty, it hisses at you and you can not summon it that day.

Once it is fully loyal, the eyes stop glowing and sit as a translucent green.

When summoned while not fully loyal, a d10 is rolled and it can stay out for up to it's loyalty divided by 10 hours or the roll of the d10, whichever is lowest.

import.name: Wintery Veldr Statue
import.description:
Used to summon a Winter Veldr. Whether it works or not depends on how loyal the Veldr is to you.

If not loyal, the Veldr can be summoned once a day and roll a d10 to see how long it can stay out.

import.description:
Via's Specialty heavy crossbow. Can fire three times then takes an action to reload all 3 shots.

Make sure to track any special arrows you might load.

import.name: Flame Dagger of Returning
import.description:
A flame dagger with a returning enchantment.

The attunee merely has to focus and can call the dagger back from within 100 studs.

When thrown for an attack, will return back to your hand if it can. Force fields, different dimensions, and other factors may prevent the return.

import.name: Frost Dagger
import.description: A dagger with a frost fog around it.

import.name: Quick Short Sword
import.description:
A short sword balanced to be able to attack twice when attacking.

This second attack does not stack with other extra attack bonuses.

import.name: Quick Short Fire Sword
import.description:
A short sword balanced to be able to attack twice when attacking.

This second attack does not stack with other extra attack bonuses.

import.name: Sonic Whip
import.description: A whip enchanted with sonic magic

import.name: Fire Elemental Core
import.description:
The core of a fire elemental.

Radiates heat but doesn't seem to have much of any other effect.

If you roll a percentile below it's loyalty, it hisses at you and you can not summon it that day, but you gains the d20 in loyalty toward you.

Once it is fully loyal, the eyes stop glowing and sit as a translucent green.

When summoned while not fully loyal, a d10 is rolled and it can stay out for up to it's loyalty divided by 10 hours or the roll of the d10, whichever is lowest.

import.name: Contract: Assassinate Qua Silverborn
import.description:
# Assassination Contract:

+ Target: Qua Silverborn
+ Requestor: Anonymous
+ Required Completion Date: 13th of Vaknaevum
+ Reward: 5000 Gold

## Details

An anonymous source has requested this and the large sum has made this somewhat of a priority for the guild. Bring this contract with the target's head per the usual channels.

It is expected that you will meet resistance from the Draconian Army and the Cortexian Protectorate. The death of these guards is not required and will not yield any bonus payment.

## Current Intel

The guild's spies have Qua in the city of Indium on the continent Turrija. The cold season in Dormevum and Alucevum may help with sneaking into the city.

We believe he will be staying there until around the 1st of Vaknaevum, when we believe he will be returning to Draconia, possibly stopping somewhere in Mikillaellera.

He is certainly under Draconia escort and with a diplomatic party. And from what we can tell, the assassination request does not involve the diplomatic mission, so to avoid drawing to much attention, avoid disrupting diplomatic affairs.

import.name: Heavy Crossbow
import.description:
Simple heavy crossbow.

Has one shot and takes a bonus action to reload.

import.name: Via's Heavy Ghost Crossbow
import.description: A magical enchantment provides the ammo to the crossbow, saving any concerns of ammo and reloading. However it can not fire mmagical crossbow bolts.

import.name: Via's Heavy Ghost Crossbow
import.description:
An enchanted variant of Via's Specialty heavy crossbow. Fires magical force arrows instead of normal bolts.

Can not be used with magical arrows.

Each shot consumes a charge.

On a critical failure, in addition to anything else that may happen, you also take 1d6 force damage.

import.name: Via's Heavy Ghost Crossbow
import.description:
An enchanted variant of Via's Specialty heavy crossbow. Fires magical force arrows instead of normal bolts.

Can not be used with magical arrows.

Each shot consumes a charge.

On a critical failure, in addition to anything else that may happen, you also take 1d6 force damage.

On a critical failure, in addition to anything else that may happen, you also take 1d6 force damage.

import.name: Knock Scroll
import.description: With minor effort causes a knock somewhere
import.hiddenDescription: Unknown scroll

import.name: Scroll
import.description:
Blank scroll for writing or enchanting.

Currently it can not receive a magical spell.

import.name: Call Cravous
import.description: Lets Cravous know where you are and that you are ready

import.name: Spectral Bean
import.description:
Spectral "Beans" can be identified by their multi-colored exterior of reds, blues, and green or yellow.

Consuming this bean pushes you to the [Ethereal Plane](:::/knowledge?id=knowledge:plane:ethereal) where you can walk around.

While in the ethereal plane, you can not interact with the material plane.

For this, you gain the effect "Ethereal" for 1 minutes (10 rounds).

+ If the bean has not turned, a successful DC check allows you to stop and end the ethereal effect at will for the duration. If failed, you are stuck in the Ethereal Plane for the entire 10 minutes.
+ If the bean has turned, a successful DC check limits your time in the Ethereal Plane to 10 minutes and a failed DC cause you to be stuck in the Ethereal Plane for 1 hour.
import.hiddenDescription: Spectaled with Green, Red, Blue, and White coloring, this bean shaped thing is a mystery to you.

import.name: Spiritual Bean
import.description:
Spiritual "Beans" can be identified by their flat white exterior.

Consuming this bean allows you to see the souls of the dead that still linger in the plane on which you reside. The length of time that the spirit noticeably lingers varies by the spirit and only indicates that the spirit's body has not been dead for longer than a year.

And while a body may move, a spirit will almost always linger where its body fell.

You ability to interact with the spirits will vary.

+ If the bean has not turned, a successful DC check causes the spirit to perceive you as their best friend (If they had one) and you should be able to hold the spirit's attention for at least 2 questions, even if you provoke it. On a failed DC, you appear as yourself to the spirits.

+ If the bean has turned, a successful check yields the above failed check, and on a failed DC, you appear as the spirit's worse enemy, if they have one. If they do not have an enemy, you appear as yourself but the spirit has distrust toward you.

You always have at least one 1 question. Though provoking the spirit will cause it to ignore you immediately. This also includes any party members the spirit might find "offensive".

Usually after 3 questions, the spirit grows bored or too distracted to maintain conversation.

import.name: Verd Bean
import.description:
Verd "Beans", literally Green Beans in Draconic, can be identified by their flat green exterior.

When consumed, you gain a green glow and have vague properties of a green power crystal.

Additionally, you gain the ability to commune with the plants around you.

+ If the bean has not turned; On a successful DC, you can speak briefly with the plants, getting simple answers to basic questions for some time. On a failed DC, you can intuit senses from the plants to give you bonuses when checking things that they might know.

+ If the bean has turned; a Successful DC allows you to intuit the plant growth, and a failed DC gives no additional effects.

In all cases, you gain a +1 bonus to perception when near plants.

If you are a druid, you get +1 to your Spell DC.

If you are a ranger, you get +1 to your attack rolls in terrain with plant growth.

import.name: Ambula Bean
import.description:
Ambula "Beans", can be identified by their flat blue exterior.

When consumed, you gain a blue glow and have vague properties of a blue power crystal.

+ If the bean has not turned; On a successful DC, you may make a wisdom check against another creature and on success you can pull the answer to one question from the creature's memory (If they have the answer). On a failed DC, you can sense the surface thoughts of nearby creatures well enough to hear pieces of it for 1 minute.

+ If the bean has turned; a Successful DC allows you to sense the surface thoughts of a creature of your choice for 1 minute, and a failed DC yields no additional effects.

In all cases, you also receive a +1 bonus to insight checks.

import.name: Lance
import.description:
A special crafted giant 2 handed polearm.

While wielding this, you can strike up to 5 studs away.

You attack at a disadvantage when attacking creatures within 5 studs of you.

import.name: Light Crossbow
import.description:
Fires a single bolt and requires reloading.

Can be reloaded as a bonus action.

import.name: Chain Boots
import.description: A pair of simple leather boots sturdy enough to offer protection.

import.name: Plate Boots
import.description: A pair of simple leather boots sturdy enough to offer protection.

import.name: Axe Arm Shield
import.description:
A shield special designed to work with large axes.

When wielded with an axe, it does not impair the use of both hands with that axe.

import.name: Pendulum
import.description:
Pendulum is a Great Axe balanced for Swinging back and forth, but it's balance is for damage instead of swinging.

Runic symbols etched into it allow you to summon a great wind behind the Axe and with attack action (Main Action or Bonus Action) you may expend a charge to swing Pendulum again.

At the end of any battle where you've used Pendulum's charges, roll constitution check at 10 + [The Number of charges used]. If failed, you must take a short rest before you can continue moving.
import.hiddenDescription: A giant 2 handed axe with some runic symbols and an interesting weight balance.

import.name: Alcohol Potion Flask
import.description: This potion flask is filled with a strong alcoholic brew.

import.name: Bracers of Momentum
import.description: Your speed follows you into your strikes, and as you strike the runic symbols on the braces glow, adding to the damage you deal.
import.hiddenDescription: A set of heavy bracers with a pair of runic symbols etched into them.
import.note: When coming out of unconsciousness, roll a percentile. On less than 50, take your 2 * ${"content":"Movement","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (${2*movement,orange}$) as ${"content":"Crushing","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage.

import.name: Castupravus
import.description:
An ornate holy weapon seemingly from the gods. You can feel the divine energy within simply by holding it and it is almost overwhelming in its power. It has golden inlays and several words engrained along the sides:

+ Castus
+ Athena
+ Daminoth
+ Serinal
+ Zeus
+ Dionysus
+ Lucian
+ Cthulhu
+ Pravus

You feel the weapon radiating with divine energy simply by holding it.

Depending on your alignment, adds an additional 2d8 of damage.

+ Good: ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Radiant"}$
+ Neutral: ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Force"}$
+ Evil: ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Necrotic"}$
import.hiddenDescription:
A giant 2 handed hammer with golden inlays and several words engrained along the sides:

+ Castus
+ Athena
+ Daminoth
+ Serinal
+ Zeus
+ Dionysus
+ Lucian
+ Cthulhu
+ Pravus

You feel the weapon radiating with divine energy simply by holding it.
import.note:
Name roughly derived from "Holy Evil".

If you have not prayed to the Hammer before using it that day, you take 1d4 psychic damage from the hammer for every attack. If you do not currently worship a god, this damage is Doubled. This happens regardless of attunement.

If you strike someone who worships the same God as you or who has the same alignment as you, you take 1d4 psychic damage from the hammer for each attack.

If you do not worship a god, you take 1 psychic damage every hour.

All conditions above trigger individually and thus can stack.

Additionally, the hammer counts as an additional entity that you are now worshiping. This may cause issues with some gods or vows.

Any holy symbols you may have are inert while you are attuned to Castupravus. This hammer is now a holy symbol for you.

Note that your God may reject you for some of these conditions, which would revoke your status as worshiping them.

Unattuning from this item requires a successful Wisdom save and a successful Religion check.

A failed Wisdom save results in you continuing to carry the hammer and a sense of impending doom filling your body.

A failed religion check after a successful Wisdom save causes you to fall dead immediately. You can still be resurrected as usual.

Can be attempted every ${7,orange}$ days.

import.name: Test Item
import.description: This is a test Item

import.name: Observance
import.description:
A hat enchanted to help the wearer focus when searching.

When making a Perception or Investigation, you may consume a charge to reroll the die. This reroll is subject to the same circumstances as the original roll (Advantage/Disadvantage, etc.) You must use the new roll after using this.
import.hiddenDescription: A wide brimmed hat that has clearly seen a few battles.
import.note:
A small discrete tracking enchantment is present on the hat as well.

Aracna (DC:30) to notice.

import.name: Obscurance
import.description: Enchanted with a magical protection aura. When you are hit by an Area of Effect spell, you can use a charge to half the damage on a failed saving throw or ignore the damage on a successful saving throw.
import.hiddenDescription: A long coat with little wear for the amount of fighting it has seen.
import.note:
A small discrete tracking enchantment is present on the hat as well.

Aracna (DC:30) to notice.

import.name: Magic Carpet
import.description:
A simple magical carpet that can hover above the ground by up to 20 studs depending on the weight it is carrying.

Speak the command word "${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Volant"}$" to use a charge and start the carpet flying for at most 4 hours. The command word maybe spoken again while the carpet is active to extend the active time by another 4 hours.

If the person who activated the carpet loses consciousness, the carpet deactivates and begins a slow decent to the ground.

Weights
+ < 100 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 15 Stud Move, 20 Stud Hover
+ 100-200 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 10 Stud Move, 10 Stud Hover
+ 200-300 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 5 Stud Move, 5 Stud Hover
+ 300 + ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 0 Stud Move, 0 Stud Hover

import.name: Magnum Carpet
import.description:
A large magical carpet that can hover above the ground by up to 30 studs depending on the weight it is carrying.

Speak the command word "${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Volant"}$" to use a charge and start the carpet flying for at most 4 hours. The command word maybe spoken again while the carpet is active to extend the active time by another 4 hours.

If the person who activated the carpet loses consciousness, the carpet deactivates and begins a slow decent to the ground.

Weights
+ < 150 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 15 Stud Move, 30 Stud Hover
+ 150-300 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 10 Stud Move, 30 Stud Hover
+ 300-500 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 5 Stud Move, 10 Stud Hover
+ 500 + ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 0 Stud Move, 0 Stud Hover

import.name: Empowering Charm
import.description: A small charm to put around your waist.

import.name: Aiming Charm
import.description: A small charm to put around your waist.

import.name: Aelestrcra
import.description:
Aelestrcra is a Great Axe forged with pieces of red crystals forming the head of the blade. While the crystal pieces do not seem to have energy in the way a power crystal does, the pressence has left a strong enchantable pressence.

You may consume a single charge per turn for any one of the below benefits:
+ Switch the attribute of the Axe from Strength to Dexterity or vice versa.
+ Reroll an ${"content":"Attack","class":"rs-orange"}$ roll or ${"content":"Religion","class":"rs-orange"}$ check.
+ Roll an additional ${"content":"1d8","class":"rs-orange"}$ of ${"content":"Force","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage. This damage would double as part of a critical and this can only be used after you know if you've hit the target or not.
+ Be able to pass through ${"content":"Red Barriers","class":"rs-orange"}$ for ${"content":"10","class":"rs-orange"}$ rounds.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate Great Axe with a crystalline red edge for its blade.

import.name: Draconian Forward Shield
import.description:
A heavy stout shield that provides a measure of protection to the bearer.

The shield additional carries a light amount of energy that can be used to double the damage reduction from a single source.

A historic special shield for members of the Draconian Forces. However, due to the cost, the shield is no longer issued to special forces of the army, though those who served tend to have them.

import.name: Spatium
import.description:
A simple silver amulet with an inlaid blue gem.

If any effect is about to fade, you can use a charge to persist that effect for either its maximum duration, or, if it is about to fade, to extend the duration one round.

Charges can be used at anytime and in any amount.

For example, if a Barbarian enters Rage and it's about to fade, a charge could be used to make it last the full 10 rounds.

Or, if Shield of Faith is about to fade, a charge could be used to have it last another round to get 11 rounds instead of 10.

This can be applied to any effect upon your person.
import.hiddenDescription: A simple silver amulet with an inlaid blue gem.

import.name: Simple Bag of Holding
import.description: A simple bag of holding that helps with carrying items in a small pocket dimension.

import.name: Ring of Osmot
import.description:
Casting spells targeting this ring cause the spells to be absorbed.

The last 2 spells cast at the ring are stored and available to be cast by the person wearing and attuned to the ring.

Can hold 2 spells of level 3 or lower to be cast. The spells are not stored with any additional strength and cast at their base level.
import.hiddenDescription: An silver band with glyphs inscribed on the side inlaid with a glowing stone.
import.note:
modifier:item:ringofosmot 

Previous Action Map:
{
    "action": [],
    "bonusAction": [],
    "reaction": []
}

import.name: Damaged Bag of Holding
import.description: The opening is a bit small and restrictive but still functional. A simple bag of holding that helps with carrying items in a small pocket dimension.

import.name: Vial of Elemental Lightning
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

import.name: Wazos Stein
import.description:
A very heavy dwarven stout known to get the brain thinking so to speak. A common drink among smithies and clerics. As long as you've got some thinking to do, it makes it easier to not become completely inebriated.

On 3 successful saves, you receive some odd insight into a thought you're having.

On 2 failed saves, you become drunk.

On 4 failed saves, you pass out for 4 hours and forget everything that happened since you started drinking. At a DC15 investigation, a failed check leads the creature investigating to believe you are dead.

import.name: Camphu Stein
import.description:
A heavy beer, quite common. Can slowly build up in your system.

Every drink increases the DC by 1.

On 1 failed save you become drunk.

On 2 failed saves you pass out for 4 hours with no rest benefits.

import.name: MQuasi Stein
import.description:
An elven beer, it is considered by all to be delicious and quite sought after.

The DC does not change for this beer however it is well known that most people who drink the beer end up sleeping well into the next day.

A failed save results in your next long rest going for 12 to 16 hours and you being unable to be awoken for that duration, however you do gain the benefits of a single long rest.

import.name: Empty Keg
import.description: A reusable keg

import.name: Sound Bomb
import.description:
Takes 1 bonus action to use.

A small explosive to distract one or 2 people.

import.name: Smoke Bomb
import.description:
Takes 1 bonus action to use.

Creates a small heavily obscured area of 10 stud radius.

import.name: Allur Aolagi Anelli
import.description: An adaptive ring that is resistant to almost all magical effects.
import.hiddenDescription: A golden band with runic symbols with a low golden glow.

import.name: Aolagi Anelli (Force)
import.description:
An adaptive ring that shifts through the spectrum of magical abilities giving resistance to effects.

Shifting the ring's alignment takes ${"content": "1 Action", "class": "rs-orange"}$ in combat.

The ring has a low red glow.

Next Shift: ${"content": "Fire Resistance", "class": "rs-orange"}$
import.hiddenDescription: Glowing Red Ring

An adaptive ring that shifts through the spectrum of magical abilities giving resistance to effects.

Next Shift: ${"content": "Lightning Resistance", "class": "rs-orange"}$

import.name: Anchor Stone
import.description:
Anchors an entity in another realm back to its original realm.

The creature must be touching the stone and then any creature can focus on the stone to anchor any other creature touching the stone.

import.name: Runic Stone
import.description: A runic stone that can hold enchantments but is currently devoid of any magical essence.

import.name: Flask of Sana Tea
import.description:
Once consumed you gain the effect "Sana Flask" for 10 minutes.

For those 10 minutes you receive full healing from any effects.

For instance, a heal of 2d4 + 4 yields 12 regardless of any rolls.

import.name: Uncandle
import.description:
A black 1 stud tall candle with black wax that has a single golden rune inlaid at its base.

This candle is lit by the shadow of any kind of kindling (Typically found in a ${"text": "Traveler's Kit", "class": "rs-orange"}$).

Once lit, this candle burns for 3 hours, creating a sphere with a radius of 20 studs in which there is utter darkness.

While "lit", the wax of the candle slowly melts similar to a normal candle.

The candle can be pinched to stop the darkness, but it will also stop when there is no wax left.

Note: You will have to track the candle manually.

import.name: Frozen Candle
import.description:
A blue 1 stud tall candle with blue wax that has a single golden rune inlaid at its base.

This candle is immune to cold damage and can only be lit by freezing the wick.

Once lit, this candle "burns" for 3 hours, creating a thunderous blizzard in a 1 mile radius.

While "lit", the wax of the candle slowly melts similar to a normal candle.

The wick of the candle "burns" until the wick is warmed. Using your hands to do so will cause you to take 1 point of cold damage. Using an item, may cause that item to freeze or suffer a similar effect.

The blizzard affects the lands until the wick is put out or all the wax is gone.

Note: You will have to track the candle manually.

import.name: Ring of the Breaker
import.description: Shifts to the ${"text": "Ring of the Conduit", "class": "rs-orange"}$

import.name: Ring of the Conduit
import.description: Shifts to the ${"text": "Ring of the Breaker", "class": "rs-orange"}$

import.name: Valkyre
import.description: Fiery Reddish Orange hard liquor.

import.name: Bottle of Valkyre Whiskey
import.description:
Fiery Reddish Orange hard liquor.

Contains 6 servings.

import.name: Mug of Limited Water
import.description: Can fill water 3 times per sun cycle.

import.name: Scroll of Weakened Fireball
import.description:
Cause a magical fireball to be hurled toward target area. The fireball deals 4d6 fire damage with a radius of 15 studs.

Outside the inner range, any effected creatures have advantage on their saving throw.

On successful save, creatures take half damage.

A large almost tome like book that seems to contain a log of Orvidon's pillaging and other hidden treasures as well as what appear to be several hundred pages of notes.

However the entire text seems to be in some kind of carefully crafted code.

import.name: Fire Arrow
import.description:
Once fired from a bow, the arrow erupts in flame.


Does an additional 1d4 fire damage to creatures, and provides 10 studs of illumination for the duration of its flight.

import.name: Sorted Bag of Holding
import.description:
An enchantment on the bag allows items to be stuffed into a pocket dimension where their weight does not weigh you down and allows you to easily think of the item you want while reaching in and have that item come to you.

For this bag, only the attuned creature may put things in or take things from the bag, and all items are stored separately so that they do not contaminate one another.

import.name: Inkarian Blade
import.description:
A large double sword in the style of the Inkarian Warriors, a center piece of their aggressive and reckless style of fighting.

When attacking with this blade, you may use a charge once per round to do another attack with this sword. This may also be used during reactionary attacks.

When you use a charge, the rate at which you may critical fail an attack doubles for that fight as you exhaust yourself with the motion.

For example, you normally critically fail an attack on a roll of a 1, however after using a charge, you now critical fail on a 2 for that attack and for the rest of that fight. If you use it again during that fight you now fail on a 4, then an 8, and so on.

Once the fight ends, your critical failure range for attacks returns to 1.


Because of the large size of this blade, when wielding this large double ended sword, critical fails always result in you awkwardly throwing the sword and the next attack against you is with advantage.

import.name: Scorpion's Pain
import.description:
A special heavy shield with the image of a scorpion on the shield.

When absorbing damage, add the amount of damage absorbed as charges to the shield to its max.

As a reaction to being struck with a damage type absorbed by this shield, you can expend all the charges as bludgeoning damage to the attacker regardless of distance from the attacker. Use this after absorbing the damage from the incoming attack.

Additionally, you may spend an action to take a defensive posture. When done, this shield acts to block ranged attacks going past you. When stuck, double the damage blocked (4d4) but you only absorb half (Rounded down).

import.name: Sicrinsian

import.note: Used in enchanting as a stabalizing agent,

import.name: Scroll of Revivify
import.description: If you can not normally cast a level ${3,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with ${1,orange}$ hit point. This spell cant return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

import.name: Empowering Charm (test)

import.name: Potion of Sleeping from a Mug
import.description:
A potion of sleeping.

When poured or consumed, roll 3d6, if it exceeds the HP of the creature consuming it, it goes to sleep for 1 hour or until it is woken.
import.note: Disappointing Mug - Doesn't Work

import.description: Possess magical properties from it's brewing that heal the creature that consumes the liquid.

If you are already female, this has no effect.

import.name: Note to Ranger
import.description:
If you're reading this note, then you're definitely tracking us.

We're here to deal with the pirates, so if you're not a pirate, please stop trying to kill us.

Sincerely,
Ash the necromancer

P.S: If you die, can I have your bones.

P.S.S: Could've trapped this, but didn't. So definitely not trying to kill you.
import.note: You pondering stumbling across this note in your pocket... When'd this get here...?

import.name: Created Food and Water
import.description: Only lasts 24 hours

import.name: Arcane Society Initiate Book
import.description:
# Initiate Hand Book

As an initiative, you have some access to parts of the Arcane Society with this book.

# Regulations

All books and tools must stay on the island without special permission from the Leoterrian magistrate. The main desk can help with reaching out to the magistrate.

# Library

The library is the center of the Arcane Society and highly guarded. Follow the instructions of your guides.


# Research

Your research is noted in the central arcanous and will grant you access to relevant information.

Your research assignment has been noted as ${"content":"Illusion Magic","class":"rs-orange"}$ and how ${"content":"Power Crystals","class":"rs-orange"}$ effect it, particularly in combat.

# Assignee

This book is assigned to ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-orange"}$ .

Note that this book is magically bound to you to prevent any theft or cloning.

import.name: The History of Vaminan Mathle
import.description:
The book covers the history of ${"content":"Vaminan Mathle","class":"rs-orange"}$ the Accountant.

Rising to power, he climbed over the corpses of other crime bosses in ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$. As the elves of ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$ established a government across the country, he retreated to the wilds. Boats served to keep his network of loans running smoothly, often hiding information in plain sight. 

While not the only financier, he quickly became the most powerful with a hand on approach, ensuring his ventures succeeded by murdering, bribing, and lying.

After 9 years, he ventured back to ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$ for a venture in magical enchantments that had hit a road block from the government regarding the risk it posed to the surrounding city. An associate of his was caught trying to bribe a Coneixian surveyor and in the investigation the Coneixian officials locked down the ports preemptively, easily leading to Vaminan's capture in his ensuing panic.

After his capture, his accounts were meticulously tracked down collected, leading to the fall of several criminal organizations. Historians tend to credit his fall to the rise of the current ${"content":"Theive's Guild","class":"rs-orange"}$, though it is believed that they took a fairly large hit to their operations as well.

To this day, criminal organizations tend to avoid having any base of operations in ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$ as the Coneixians maintain strict borders and have since maintained a process of quickly locking down towns when criminal activity is being investigated.

import.name: Cieo
import.description:
A small arcane enchantment serves to isolate any magical effects to a pocket dimension. This will prevent magical enchantments like ${"content":"Alarm","class":"rs-orange"}$ from notifying the enchanter.

The small light power of the enchantment makes it difficult to detect but also makes it hard to use. With limited charges and a bit of arcane handling skill needed to handle the gloves. Fortunately the wearer knows if the pocket dimension is ready before attempting to use the enchantment but it is only good for 10 minutes and needs 5 minutes before it can be used again.

The user must pass a ${"content":"DC:10 Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ check to create a stable pocket dimension.

import.name: Viatjar
import.description:
As a reaction, you may use a charge to completely dodge an attack.

On a successful DC, you may move 5 studs in one direction.

On a failed DC, roll 1d8 and you move up to 30 studs in that direction (1 Forward, Clockwise).
import.hiddenDescription: Lite cloth pants that have a slight shimmer to them.

import.name: Trifulla
import.description:
A large, heavy three bladed axe with an enchanted green blade for one of the heads.

When swung, the weight  shifts and adds to the power behind the swing, however control can also be loss easily.

However, the weight also makes it easier to deal impressive amounts of damage with every swing.

And a charge may be expended when leading with the green blade to deal additional ${(str/2)d4,darkorange}$ poison damage to the target.

This weapon critical fails on 1-4 and critically hits on 19 & 20.

import.name: Poison Cella Armor
import.description:
Cella Leather armor is a special leather armor that offers protection against those who would harm you.

This armor protects against poison damage.

import.name: Trifulla (NPC)
import.description:
A large, heavy three bladed axe with an enchanted green blade for one of the heads.

When swung, the weight  shifts and adds to the power behind the swing, however control can also be loss easily.

However, the weight also makes it easier to deal impressive amounts of damage with every swing.

And a charge may be expended when leading with the green blade to deal additional ${(str/2)d4,darkorange}$ poison damage to the target.

This weapon critical fails on 1-4 and critically hits on 19 & 20.

import.name: Cape of Serenity
import.description: Made of a darker material, it improves sneaking in shadows.

import.name: Note from the Guild (Vaminan Mathle)
import.description:
In the imperial library, there is a book in the history section of the imperial library on the history of ${"content":"Vaminan Mathle","class":"rs-orange"}$.

It is the only known copy of the book and it is important for no one to know that it is being removed.

Once retrieved, leave hidden with the gloves.

import.name: Worker Shirt
import.description: A simple shirt worn by workers.

import.name: Worker Pants
import.description: A simple pair of pants worn by workers.

import.name: Harbinger
import.description:
A specialty piece signed under the trigger as created by ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-orange"}$.

An extremely heavy crossbow that gives off a dark purple shadow around itself. Each shot requires and consumes a charge from the crossbow as well as needing special ammo to fire it.

Despite its weight, the crossbow does not hinder movement. Though it is almost impossible to hide, leading anyone who sees you to be skeptical of your intentions.

Those hit must pass a DC${10 + int,darkorange}$ Constitution or  Wisdom save or be cursed, gaining the ${"content":"Harbinger's Curse","class":"rs-orange"}$ effect.

Shots from this crossbow may deal additional damage depending on the bolt used.
import.note:
The dark corruption flowing through the crossbow requires souls to satiate it.

The corruption speaks to the attuned user, asking for blood, generally for the attuned's, amounting to 1HP on waking from a long rest. If this isn't fulfilled, all attacks from this crossbow are at a disadvantage until the ritual is completed.

If it does not take a life every week, it deals ${10d10,darkorange}$ Necrotic damage to the attuned creature when it wakes at the start of the next week. If this would kill you, pass a ${DC15,darkorange}$ Constitution save to remain conscious.

import.name: Harbinger
import.description:
A specialty piece signed under the trigger as created by ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-orange"}$.

An extremely heavy crossbow that gives off a dark purple shadow around itself. Each shot requires and consumes a charge from the crossbow as well as needing special ammo to fire it.

Despite its weight, the crossbow does not hinder movement. Though it is almost impossible to hide, leading anyone who sees you to be skeptical of your intentions.

Those hit must pass a DC${10 + int,darkorange}$ Constitution or  Wisdom save or be cursed, gaining the ${"content":"Harbinger's Curse","class":"rs-orange"}$ effect.

Shots from this crossbow may deal additional damage depending on the bolt used.

Loading this cross bow takes ${"content":"All Turn Actions","class":"rs-orange"}$; All Actions and Bonus Actions (But Not Movement) are used to reload. Any abilities that grant additional Actions or Bonus Actions are negated.
import.hiddenDescription: A dark, but powerful, aura flows off of this crossbow. It's shadow seems to float around it.
import.note:
The dark corruption flowing through the crossbow requires souls to satiate it.

The corruption speaks to the attuned user, asking for blood, generally for the attuned's, amounting to 1HP on waking from a long rest. If this isn't fulfilled, all attacks from this crossbow are at a disadvantage until the ritual is completed.

If it does not take a life every week, it deals ${10d10,darkorange}$ Necrotic damage to the attuned creature when it wakes at the start of the next week. If this would kill you, pass a DC${15,darkorange}$ Constitution save to remain conscious.

import.name: Foretold Death
import.description: A special bolt for ${Harbinger,darkorange}$.

import.name: Foretold Bloodtrail
import.description:
A special bolt for ${Harbinger,darkorange}$.

On a critical hit with this bolt, the target begins to bleed profusely regardless or race or size.

When used against ${Dragons,darkorange}$ and ${Dragonborn,darkorange}$, consider 18, 19, and 20 as critical hits.
import.hiddenDescription: The head of the bolt has hollow holes as though to open something or maximize bleeding.

import.name: Foretold Ailment
import.description:
A special bolt for ${Harbinger,darkorange}$.

When a creature is hit, it must pass a DC${15 + int,darkorange}$ Constitution save or be poisoned with ${"content":"Foretold Ailment","class":"rs-orange"}$ Effect.

This save is separate from the save for ${"content":"Harbinger's Curse","class":"rs-orange"}$ Effect.
import.hiddenDescription: You hear a liquid inside the bolt and see tips for dispensing a liquid, but you know not what.

import.name: Spell Copying Inkwell
import.description:
A magical inkwell used for copying spells from your ${"content":"Spellbook", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to a ${"content":"Scroll", "class":"rs-orange"}$ or vice versa.

To copy a spell, you will need a number of inkwells equal to the level of the spell multiplied by itself. So a level 1 spell requires 1 kit, a level 3 spell requires 9 kits, and a level 9 spell requires 81 kits.

If you are a Wizard and possess an ${"content":"Alchemy Kit", "class":"rs-orange"}$, you may perform an DC${20-int,darkorange}$ Alchemy Kit check for this kit to count as 2 kits instead of one. If you are using more than 2 kits, perform this check twice:  
0. All kits are used to copy the spell
1. You use 3/4s of the kits rounded up
2. You use 1/2 of the kits rounded up
import.note: Used for copying spells

import.name: Scroll of Arcane Portcullis
import.description:
Concentrate on and name a creature that is on your current plane of existence. That creature then suddenly appears at a location of your choice within ${30,darkorange}$ studs of your current location.

The named creature performs a DC${19,darkorange}$ Wisdom save against this scroll. If it succeeds,  it may choose to accept the summoning.

If you are not able to cast level 9 arcane spells, you must pass a DC${19,darkorange}$. On a failed check, the spell still casts, but the target automatically succeeds their wisdom save and knows your location.

[ ${Level,darkorange}$:${9,darkorange}$ ]

import.name: Forlorn
import.description: A special bolt made for the ${Harbinger,darkorange}$ crossbow.

import.name: Fairy's Grace
import.description: A purple shimmering cape that transforms when worn.
import.note:
When attempting to persuade someone, must pass a DC${15,darkorange}$ Wisdom save or the words that are actually spoken go in the opposite direction as intended.

Enchanted with a ${Level,darkorange}$:${5,darkorange}$ curse for this effect.
