import.name: Bane's Recurve
import.description: A recurve bow that when shot while attuned adds Acid damage to the tips of fired arrows. When shot, a charge can be used to detonate the arrow as a Bonus Action to deal an additional 2d12 Acid damage in a ${3,orange}$ radius. If you miss by less than ${3,orange}$, this area includes your target.
import.hiddenDescription: A bow with green inscriptions and a golden draw string.

import.name: Wall's Warhammer
import.description: Some kind of specialty piece, enchanted with Evocation magic and bears a golden insignia on its hammer: When striking a creature, the magic of the hammer increases the damage. Additionally, when struck, a charge may be used to perform an Attack that creature. This attack works as normal, but a second attack does not occur (From feats such as Extra Attack).
import.hiddenDescription: A large runic war hammer with a gold insignia on the back side of the hammer:
import.note: Old armor of the Vindica. Runs the risk of being seen by someone who knows. Also being unable to account for the insignia may alert some guards.

import.name: Hunter's Decree
import.description: Blue and green tinted leather armor bearing a golden symbol on the chest: . Any spell below level ${int + 1,orange}$ cast within ${8,orange}$ studs of you with "No Modifications" to it consumes a charge from this armor and is instantly countered. This additionally applies to items, such as scrolls or rings that cast spells. You as the attuned, however, are able to use items without them being countered.
import.hiddenDescription: Blue and green tinted leather armor bearing a golden symbol on the chest: Seems to have Abjuration magic upon it.
import.note: Modifications include Sorcerer points and crystals

import.name: Mountainous Plate
import.description: A heavy protective enchantment sits upon this plate armor and seems to project your pressence out further than you actually are. You instantly fail any Dexterity save forced upon you. For any Area of effect spells that happen near you, you act as a wall blocking a cone from the epicenter of the explosion. If you are the epicenter of the explosion, the radius is considered ${0,orange}$ and you are the sole target of the spell. When struck by a spell, you may use a charge to roll the same number of dice as the unmodified, lowest level version of that spell to heal up to the damage you received. Additionally, you count as partial cover for allies immediately adjacent to you if a ranged attack comes from the opposite side of you.
import.hiddenDescription: Extremely heavy and yet compact, this chest piece bears a symbol on it: Seems to have Abjuration magic upon it.

import.name: Vial fo Liquid Green Crystal
import.description: Liquefied Green Power Crystal. You aren't sure of the properties of this item...

import.name: Vial fo Liquid Red Crystal
import.description: Liquefied Red Power Crystal. You aren't sure of the properties of this item...

import.name: Vial fo Liquid Blue Crystal
import.description: Liquefied Blue Power Crystal. You aren't sure of the properties of this item...

import.name: Vial fo Liquid Blue Crystal
import.description: Liquefied Orange Power Crystal. You aren't sure of the properties of this item...

import.name: Vial fo Liquid Lime Crystal
import.description: Liquefied Lime Power Crystal. You aren't sure of the properties of this item...

import.name: Cat Kin Stone
import.description: An outline of 3 cats is inscribed into the side of the stone. Those who know and have befriended the 3 kin, may use a charge to call forth the 3 cats of Reykurax. When successfully called forth, roll 1d12. The cats spirit springs forth from the stone and are present in your realm for that many hours before returning. If the 3 are not in Reykurax, the call fails.

import.name: Warrior's Bracers
import.description: These silver lined leather bracers allow the attuned to expend a charge and strain themselves to take another attack after having taken an attack action against the creature. You may attack another creature, but you can not move from your previous attack. In addition to the extra attack however, you suffer 1d12 Psychic damage.

import.name: Fury's Might
import.description: This giant two-handed radiant sword pulses with divine energy. Any number of charges may be used to increase or decrease the Attack of yourself or another creature within ${4*wis,orange}$ studs of you. Each charge used increases that creatures Attack roll by ${1,orange}$. Must be used before you would know if the attack wouldhit or not. Your Wisdom modifier effects the range and charges for this sword.
import.hiddenDescription: A large sword with a radiant blade.

import.name: Preservation
import.description: This shield preserves the dead of those around it.
import.hiddenDescription: A skull adorns this small circular shield.

import.name: Brewer's Guards
import.description:
A pair of bracers that serve to help an alchemist with brewing potions.

A charge can be used to re-roll an alchemist kit skill check .

import.name: Momento
import.description:
Once attuned to Momento, on a successful attack, you can speak the command word and use a charge to attempt to dominate a creature.

The creature makes a strength saving throw, that when failed will obey you for 2 rounds.
import.hiddenDescription: A very ornate mace with a pearly opalescence to it.

import.name: Royal Cloak
import.description: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. Having invoked Legend Lore, against this cloak, you've learned its history; That it was worn by someone who seemed to be an aid to the king, consulting with the royal family and helping to move things around the castle. As the visions continued, the castle appeared to be under attack, guards busily running down hallways and a familiar chaos in the rooms. As the vision came to an end, it was noted that the aid, with a dozen others from the castle, had retreated into the cellar area and hid where the cload was found. A bright shining creature of seemingly pure energy the last sight of those in the room, a flash of light the only scene between the aid in the room and Quincy retrieving the cloak.
import.hiddenDescription: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. Found in Hwand.

import.name: Drio
import.description: When casting a spell through this wand, roll ${1,orange}$d4 to determine the extra damage type and ${1,orange}$d8 to determine the amount of extra damage. Depending on the distance to the spell's target, the bonus damage may not take effect. For the 1d4: 1. Poison damage. 2. Acid damage. 3. Fire damage. 4. Poison damage with the 1d8 roll doubled. At any time, a charge can be used while casting a spell to additionally summon local creatures to attack the target(s), with a maximum number of creatures proportional to your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$).
import.hiddenDescription: An unknown green wand.
import.note: Dwarven for Beast

import.name: Knocked Chime
import.description: A small musical-esq mythril chime adorns this silver chain necklace with part of the chain hanging with the chime. A charge may be used by striking the chime with the chain, making a Performance check, causing all locks within audible range to unlock and all doors or other passages to move to an open state. Magical locks and doors open based on their difficulty and the rolled Performance check.

import.name: Portable Tent
import.description: When resting (or Elvish Transing), any number of charges may be used. The maximum number of charges is proportional to your Constitution modifier (${con,orange}$). On a Long Rest, you reduce the amount of time needed for a full rest by ${1,orange}$ hour per charge used. On a short rest, a charge may be used to gain 1d12 of Healing.

import.name: Alchemist's Journal
import.description: Large and extensive, seems to cover alchemical ways of speaking with the dead. The author goes on to describe special flowers and soil found only in Reykurax. Having read the book more thoroughly, you now know how to identify Necrasoil and Dauoa Flowers.
import.hiddenDescription: A thick book that will take some time to read if you can figure out the language and how to read it...
import.note: Investigation: [0] Written in Abyssal, this journal is a bit tricky to read if the language is not spoken. --- [60] The book notes progress in brewing a potion that achieves her goals but is still finding some issues. The elixir does seem to work better in Reykurax than in the Material Plane. [85] Contains the recipe for the brewing of a Elixir of Morletum, which allows the user to speak with dead spirits. [100] Possession of this book while able to read it reduces the difficulty of brewing a Elixir of Morletum by 5.

import.name: Temporal Knot
import.description: A powerful runic enchantment encloses a half green, half blue, power crystal atop a golden chain. While attuned, you may use the charges to manipulate localized small fragments of time within range. In Combat, you may use a charge to re-roll your Initiative or to have another creature re-roll its Initiative. This can only be used at the start of a round after you know who the current first creature of the round is. A charge can also be used as a Reaction to have any creature in combat re-roll an Attack, Damage, or Saving Throw roll. Outside of combat, this can be used to have any creature re-roll a performed Skill Check. Because of the temporal distortion, this occurs with no save. However some creatures may be resistant to this occurring with varying levels of awareness to the distortion occuring.
import.hiddenDescription: A runes encloses a half green, half blue, power crystal atop a golden chain.

import.name: Spirit's Vow: Purrsalot
import.description: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver that you know to read "Sir Purrsalot" and a small cat toy dangling from it. While attuned to this bracelet, you perform an Animal Handling skill check every morning, adding the rolled value to this item's charges. Once at 100 charges, a spirit cat appears for you; Sir Purrsalot. After appearing, you continue to perform an Animal Handling every morning, but this now determines what Sir Purrsalot will do that day: + Critical Failure: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, all creatures can hear him and all creature can see him. Even if the bracelet is unattuned, he will continue to exist and pester you, even through your sleep, should you manage to sleep. + 0-5: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, however only you can see or hear him. When you attempt to sleep, roll a d100 for every hour you are asleep, on a 20 or less, Sir Purrsalot wakes you by pawing your face, distinctly asking for food. + 6-10: Quietly stalks the area around you looking for treats or presents. His posture will change depending on how he feels or if he's found something. + 11-15: Sits on your shoulder and purrs. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. + 15-20: Sits on your shoulder and purrs and others see him as a stark white cat in adorable armor. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws as well as Persuassion checks. + 21-30: Sits on your shoulder and purrs but will assist in combat. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma and in combat Sir Purrsalot will join the fray dealing 1d4 Slashing damage and moving around the field distracting enemies. Sir Purrsalot is immune to physical damage and can only be removed by being dispelled or other high level manipulation magic. Usually resulting in him simply returning to your shoulder. + 31+: Sir Purrsalot lounges on your shoulder and you are able to speak with him in Common. Any requests of him will depend on his mood and how you've treated him. Gain the effect Purring Cat when appropriate.
import.hiddenDescription: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver and a small cat toy dangling from it...
import.note: Made in Reykurax

import.name: Bracelet of Insight
import.description: A rare but powerful enchantment is beset upon this golden bracelet, allowing the wearer to see more clearly into the actions of others.

import.name: Bracelet of Foresight
import.description: Silver runes line the deep blue band of this bracelet, allowing the wearer to change the fate of creatures around them. When a creature in range rolls to deal Damage, whether by Attack or Spell, you may use a charge to have any creature in range reroll a single damage per charge used. Any creature in the furthest range can have a single die manipulated once, any creature inside the inner range can have any number of die manipulated. This bracelet can only manipulate die involved in determining damage dealt.
import.hiddenDescription: Silver runes line the deep blue band of this strange bracelet.

import.name: Odd note from Hwand
import.description: Quickly scribbled notes sit atop this silken paper.
import.note: [Written in Dwarven] The crypt golem is acting wierd, need to follow up on a few things: + The color alignment for the floor isn't working, once the green power crystals power the floor the golem doesn't get empowered correctly + The Even/Odd crystal count isn't responding correctly to open the doors in the right order + He does seem to at least achieve invulnerability once all 3 base crystal powers are lined up I suspect we inverted a power coupler last night while drinking and swearing up and down that the installation of the nephew's tomb in Reykurax was supposed to be easy and it was anything but. Self note, no more drinking on the job.

import.name: Rurgo's Alchemy Extensions
import.description: Seems to be bearing Conjuration and Transmutation magics, this set of vials and mixing tools seem augment those of an Alchemist's Kit. These additions greatly improve one's ability to create alchemical concoctions. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.hiddenDescription: A set of vials and mixing equipment seemingly meant to extend those of an Alchemist's Kit. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.note: Cursed with Rurgo's ghost, any attempts to use it without befriending him result in an additional -${10,orange}$ to Alchemist Kit checks. Additionally, Rurgo being a jester of sorts, occasionally brews innocuous bombs of sorts, causing ones pack or room to occasionally explode with smoke or the like. Rurgo's alignment was that of Adjuration. Once befriended and calmed the negative modifier is removed and the surprise bombs ceasee. The user also gains advantage when brewing Abjuration potions.

import.name: Luck's Future
import.description: Runic symbols for luck seem to decorate each card of the deck, calling on Luck's Grace for the reader. You may make a tarot reading of any creature or yourself. However, when performing a reading on yourself, roll 3 d20s to determine the Skill Checks that are effected (Or perform an actual Tarot Reading) and after each roll, perform a skill check and note the saved rolls that you can use later to replace any roll for that skill check: 1. Acrobatics 2. Animal Handling 2. Arcana 2. Athletics 2. Concentration 2. Deception 2. History 2. Initiative 2. Insight 2. Intimidation 2. Investigation 2. Medicine 2. Nature 2. Perception 2. Performance 2. Persuasion 2. Religion 2. Sleight of Hand 2. Stealth 2. Survival Any skill check made over the day can be replaced by the saved roll. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.hiddenDescription: An intriguing set of tarot cards with runic tapestry. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
import.note: When used without befriending Grace, a laugh can be heard and the creature suffers a critical fail. If replacing a critical fail, the creature also suffers 2d6 Psychic damage. To befriend Grace, must attune with the bracers and only use the rolls for things she sees fit. Grace's Loves: + Animals + Song + Writing + History

import.name: Banner of Power
import.description:
A special banner that can be thrust into the ground as an action at any time, channeling arcane power to those near-by.

Creatures in the banner's radius have advantage on normal and magical attack rolls. Creatures in the extended range only have advantage on normal attacks.

This banner has ${10,orange}$HP and ${10+int,orange}$AC while planted and, once placed, can not be retrieved until combat has ended. Once retrieved, the banner is considered healed.

Only ${1,orange}$ banner may be active for you and your allies at a time. If multiple are placed, the first one simply ceases to apply its effect. It may still be collected after the battle and retains its enchanting effect.

import.name: Brewer's Signet
import.description: The Symbol of Dionysus adorns this signet. The wearer receives a small bonus to using Alchemy Kits, Arcana skill checks, and a minor reduction from Acid damage while attuned to the ring.

import.name: Ancient Novela
import.description: This is a simple book that tells a fictional story. Some entertainment value is had.

import.name: King's Guard Cloak
import.description: A royal blue cape that bears the King's Guard symbol prominently on the cape. When affected by magic, roll 1d6. On a 6, magic attempting to effect the wearer is nullified unless it is explicitly allowed. If the wearer is not aware of this process, magic is nullified on a 6 always.
import.hiddenDescription: A royal blue cape with an odd symbol prominently on the cape.
import.note: Roll 1d6, on a 6, magic attempting to effect the wearer is nullified unless it is explicitly allowed. If the wearer is not aware of this process, magic is nullified on a 6 always.

import.name: Nomys Feather
import.description:
A feather from an extremely rare bird that has been magically treated to give the wearer an air of mystique about them.

While worn, your hair blows in magically created gentle wind, giving you an almost ever present glow.

import.name: Seer's Glasses
import.description: A pair of runic glass lenses are set in this golden frame. A charge can be used as an Action to see the true form of any creature or object for ${2*wis,orange}$ minutes. When a charge is used, roll a Perception check. Any object or creature that is not hiding will be revealed, however those that have made a Stealth check will only be fully visible if you beat their roll. Otherwise you will see nothing or they will appear as "distorted" but you will not be able to make out their true form. Limited only by your normal vision. Can extend through non-magical Spyglasses, however magical ones will require an Arcana check to handle the multiple magics effectively.
import.note:
Expensive for the number of enchantments present and the lack of attunement

+ 1 Enchantment per lense
+ 1 For the frame to carry the sight
+ 1 For sustaining the sight
+ 1 To allude Attunement

import.name: Potion of Clarity
import.description: When consumed, your mind is cleared of any effects that may be ailing it and you are immune to any mind-altering effects for ${1,orange}$ minute.

import.name: Bracers of Separation
import.description: Each bracer is composed of 2 rings that interlock magically. While attuned, each may be separated as an Action (2 Actions to separate both). The bracers allow you to maintain control of your hands and you continue to feel sensations from them as normal. The separation is painless though it may take some getting used to for controlling your hands (Sleight of Hand). Should you lose attunement while your hands are separated however it is as though your hands have been cut off at the bracers.

import.name: Moonscythe Staff
import.description: A large staff with a crescent moon shaped and styled scythe at the top. Seemingly more for decoration than utility, but the blade is sturdy and harmful none the less. When an attack or spell successfully hits at night with view of the sky, any number of charges can be used to call down a beam of moonlight for an additional 1d8 Radiant damage per charge used. On a full moon this becomes 1d12.
import.hiddenDescription: A large staff with a crescent moon shaped and styled scythe at the top. Seemingly more for decoration than utility, but the blade is sturdy and harmful none the less.

import.name: Shattered Power
import.description: A large heavy war hammer with a specially crafted back to the hammers head piece that allows a power crystal to be locked into place. While attuned and wielding this, you additionally critical on a ${19,orange}$ When a crystal is inserted, this war hammer resets to max charges. The crystal is consumed and not usable after being attached, however it can be removed, at which point it disintegrates if any part of it is left. When striking a creature, on a critical, a charge can be spent, a burst of energy exploding forth from the war hammer and fracturing the crystal. The effect varies with the power crystal that is used. + **Red**: Explodes for in a fiery flash in a 10 stud radius around you dealing 2d6 Fire damage (Not multiplied by the critical) to all creatures in the area except you. These creatures make a Dexterity DC${10+wis,orange}$ saving throw and take half damage on success. + **Blue**: Up to ${wis,orange}$ creatures of your choice in ${30,orange}$ studs of you receive 6d6 Temporary HP. + **Green**: Deal an additional 1d8 Poison damage (Multiplied with the critical strike as usual) and heals you for 2d6 damage. + **Orange**: Unknown + **Lime**: Unknown + **Silver**: Unknown + **Gold**: Unknown
import.note: A weapon of the ancient blacksmiths of old, this is the last of its kind and its knowledgeis lost to time.

import.name: Portable Tent
import.description: When resting (or Elvish Transing), any number of charges may be used. The maximum number of charges is proportional to your Constitution modifier (${con,orange}$). On a Long Rest, you reduce the amount of time needed for a full rest by ${1,orange}$ hour per charge used. On a short rest, a charge may be used to gain 1d12 of Healing.

import.name: Portable Tent
import.description: Good for a single creature to rest. When resting (or Elvish Transing), any number of charges may be used. The maximum number of charges is proportional to your Constitution modifier (${con,orange}$). On a Long Rest, you reduce the amount of time needed for a full rest by ${1,orange}$ hour per charge used. On a short rest, a charge may be used to gain 1d12 of Healing.

import.name: Portable Tent

import.name: Appa
import.description: A small stuffed animal belonging to Torinn.

import.name: Guardian Wraith Blade
import.description:
A ghostly one handed blade wielded by enchanted wraiths.

The blades tend to vanish to the aether once their bound spirit is slain.

import.name: Intricate Chain Weave
import.description:
A tight weave of magically etched runic chain links help to protect the attuned.

A charge may be used to cancel an incoming critical hit.

A tight weave of magically etched runic chain links help to protect the attuned.

A charge may be used to cancel an incoming critical hit.
import.hiddenDescription: An intricate tight weave of chain links form this armor and each link seems to have a small rune inscribed in it.

import.name: Vial of Rotten Strawberries
import.description: Why? Because we can.

import.name: Decree
import.description: Spells cast through this wand exert a great pressure over those struck by the spell. When dealing damage with a spell cast through this wand, each creature receives an additional 1d4 Psychic damage, regardless of how many creatures are struck. When casting a single target spell, a charge can be used to submit the target to an additional Constitution save against your Spell DC and on failure, that creature loses ${1,orange}$d6 worth of spell slots (1 Level 6, or 6 Level 1s, any combination totaling the rolled value in levels).
import.hiddenDescription: An unknown dark blue wand.
import.note: Dwarven for Beast

import.name: Wandering Dust
import.description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${20,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${20*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

import.name: Cape of Invisibility
import.description: While heavier than it looks, this cape allows the attuned to become invisible for a period of time equal to your ${Wisdom,orange}$ Modifier (${wis,orange}$) in hours when a charge is used. This invisibility is ended when you take any Action. Use of multiple charges does not stack, the invisibility merely ends the duration of time from the last used charge. If the cape is and removed while the invisibility is active, the invisibility ends, and the cape can be removed by force while you are invisible. The invisibility does not extend to any other creature, regardless of that creature's position to you.

import.name: Lesser Ring of the Arcane
import.description: A powerful ring crafted from a Blue Power Crystal and inscribed with inlaid golden runes, this ring grants the attuned an additional 5th Level spell slot.

import.name: Greater Ring of Empowerment
import.description: A powerful ring crafted from a Blue Power Crystal and inscribed with inlaid golden runes, this ring grants the attuned an additional 5th Level spell slot.

The invisibility does not extend to any other creature, regardless of that creature's position to you.

import.name: Dust of Pixies
import.description:
When attuned, a charge worth of dust can be thrown into the air and cause any creatures in a radius equal to your ${Intelligence,orange}$ Modifier (${int,orange}$).

All creatures in the area make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${10+wis,orange}$ save. Those who fail are effected by ${"content":"Pixie Tongue","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ causing them to randomly insult other creature's with whom they are interacting.

import.name: Dust of Pixies
import.description:
When attuned, a charge worth of dust can be thrown into the air and cause any creatures in a radius equal to your ${Intelligence,orange}$ Modifier (${int,orange}$).

All creatures in the area make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${10+wis,orange}$ save. Those who fail are effected by ${"content":"Pixie Tongue","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ causing them to random insult other creature's with whom they are interacting.

import.name: Amnesia Dust
import.description:
Dust slowly fills the pouch using the excess energy from the attuned creature.

When a creature is exposed to the dust, it must make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${8 + wis,orange}$ save or forget the last ${minute,orange}$ from its memory.

However the dust is difficult to handle and you may expose yourself to the dust. When used, make a ${Sleight,orange}$ ${of,orange}$ ${Hand,orange}$ DC${10-dex,orange}$ Skill Check, and on failure you also forget the last minute.

Any creature effected by forgetfulness has its memory restored when exposed to a Level ${3,orange}$ or higher healing spell.

import.name: Displacer Chest
import.description: Created from the fur of a magical Displacer Beast, when struck a charge can be used to immediately phase yourself into the Ethereal Plane, phasing back after the damage has passed. Area of effect attacks and other such dangers that have more of a persistence damage (Such as Flame Sphere) can have a charge used to immediately succeed the saving throw, however this can not be used after you've rolled for the save as it would be too late. Can hold charges equal to your Dexterity plus your Intelligence Modifiers.

import.name: Displacer Chest
import.description: Created from the fur of a magical Displacer Beast, when struck a charge can be used to immediately phase yourself into the Ethereal Plane, phasing back after the damage has passed. Can hold charges equal to your Dexterity plus your Intelligence Modifiers. [Active Enchantments: ${1,orange}$]

import.name: Ring of Focus
import.description: A seemingly simple silver band with runes etched inside the band. When performing an Attack or Skill Check, you may use a charge to add ${1,orange}$d4 to your roll. Only one charge can be used per roll. If rolling with Advantage or Disadvantage, this is added to the number that would be the result.

import.name: Ring of Focus
import.description: A seemingly simple silver band with runes etched inside the band. When performing an Attack or Skill Check, you may use a charge to add ${1,orange}$d4 to your roll. Only one charge can be used per roll. If rolling with Advantage or Disadvantage, this is added to the number that would be the result.

import.name: Ring of Focus
import.description: A seemingly simple silver band with runes etched inside the band. When performing an Attack or Skill Check, you may use a charge to add ${1,orange}$d4 to your roll. Only one charge can be used per roll. If rolling with Advantage or Disadvantage, this is added to the number that would be the result.

import.name: Grave Ender
import.description: An extremely large and heavy hammer said to have been created by the ancients and identified by the three runes in the hammer's head piece seemingly laid as liquid power crystal, one of red, one of blue, and one of green. Any creature struck dead by this war hammer is Laid to Rest. In addition to not being revivable, the corpse can not be used in anyway. When striking with this hammer, its command word can be spoken to use a charge and invoke one of the 3 runes in the hammer, only 1 rune may be invoked at a time. ### Red The strike deals an additional 2d12 Necrotic damage. ### Blue The target is Silenced for ${1,orange}$ minute. There is no save unless the creature has special resistances. ### Green You heal for ${(con*10)%,orange}$ of the total damage dealt.
import.note: If Ancient is known, any number of runes can be invoked in a single strike, but each rune still consumes a charge. If all three runes are invoked at once, the creature is Marked for Death and will suffer the curse of being Laid to Rest when it dies. There is no terminal duration to Laid to Rest, however it is a curse. Command Word: "Oblivion" in any language

import.name: Cape of Skulking
import.description:
While heavier than it looks, this cape allows the attuned to become invisible for ${1,orange}$ hour and helps obscure your pressence.

If the cape is and removed while the invisibility is active, the invisibility ends, and the cape can be removed by force while you are invisible.

The invisibility does not extend to any other creature, regardless of that creature's position to you.

import.name: Lesser Arcanic Band
import.description: A simple runic band that improves the power of the user's spells.

import.name: Arcanic Band
import.description: A simple runic band that improves the power of the user's spells.

import.name: Cauldron
import.description: A cauldron that can be placed somewhere to brew potions in bulk.
import.note: Specialty brewing item.

import.name: Speech Pills of the Lower Realms
import.description: Pill to learn a new language. The general instructions are listed in several languages, including common, however the ritual listed seems to require understanding Ancient to perform accurately, but enough is explained to try. If you don't understand Ancient, make a Wisdom DC${25,orange}$ Save. On success, you learn a language of your choice from below. However a critical failure will result in your brain being overwhelmed and you will take 5d10 Psychic damage. If you do understand Ancient, you may simply choose a new language to learn. Learn one of the languages of the lower realms, the Elemental Planes, The Four Hells, and Reykurax, listed below: + Aquan + Primordial + Infernal + Abyssal
import.hiddenDescription: Some weird symbols mark the box, they appear to be in ancient.
import.note: Inscriptions match the languages on the Lower part of  the Citadel entrance

import.name: Speech Pills of the Material Realms

Learn one of the languages of the Material Plane listed below: + Draconic + Dwarvish + Elvish + Giant + Gnomish + Orc
import.hiddenDescription: Some weird symbols mark the box, they appear to be in ancient.

Learn one of the languages of Skapari, Borgari, Umqambi, and Comissari listed below: + Celestial + Auran + Primordial

import.name: Second Arcane Restoration
import.description: When consumed, you gain ${1,orange}$ Level 2 Spell Slot up to your max.

import.name: Minor Arcane Recovery
import.description: When consumed, you may recover up to ${3,orange}$ levels worth of Spell Slots up to your max. Examples: + ${1,orange}$ Level 1 Sepll Slot & ${1,orange}$ Level 2 Sepll Slot + ${3,orange}$ Level 1 Sepll Slots + ${1,orange}$ Level 3 Sepll Slot

import.name: Arcane Recovery
import.description: When consumed, you may recover up to ${5,orange}$ levels worth of Spell Slots up to your max. Examples: + ${3,orange}$ Level 1 Sepll Slot & ${1,orange}$ Level 2 Sepll Slot + ${5,orange}$ Level 1 Sepll Slots + ${1,orange}$ Level 5 Sepll Slot

import.name: Major Arcane Recovery
import.description: When consumed, you may recover up to ${7 ,orange}$ levels worth of Spell Slots up to your max. Examples: + ${3,orange}$ Level 1 Sepll Slot & ${2,orange}$ Level 2 Sepll Slots + ${7,orange}$ Level 1 Sepll Slots + ${1,orange}$ Level 7 Sepll Slot

import.name: Third Arcane Restoration
import.description: When consumed, you gain ${1,orange}$ Level 3 Spell Slot up to your max.

import.name: First Arcane Restoration
import.description: When consumed, you gain ${1,orange}$ Level 1 Spell Slot up to your max.

import.name: Spirit's Vow: Meowsaton
import.description: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver that you know to read "Meowston" and a small cat toy dangling from it. While attuned to this bracelet, you perform an Animal Handling skill check every morning, adding the rolled value to this item's charges. Once at 100 charges, a spirit cat appears for you; Meowsaton. After appearing, you continue to perform an Animal Handling every morning, but this now determines what Meowsaton will do that day: + Critical Failure: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, all creatures can hear him and all creature can see him. Even if the bracelet is unattuned, he will continue to exist and pester you, even through your sleep, should you manage to sleep. + 0-5: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, however only you can see or hear him. When you attempt to sleep, roll a d100 for every hour you are asleep, on a 20 or less, Meowsaton wakes you by pawing your face, distinctly asking for food. + 6-10: Quietly stalks the area around you looking for treats or presents. His posture will change depending on how he feels or if he's found something. + 11-15: Sits on your shoulder and purrs. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. + 15-20: Sits on your shoulder and purrs and others see him as a stark white cat in adorable armor. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws as well as Persuassion checks. + 21-30: Sits on your shoulder and purrs but will assist in combat. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma and in combat Meowsaton will join the fray dealing 1d4 Slashing damage and moving around the field distracting enemies. Meowsaton is immune to phystical damage and can only be removed by being dispelled or other high level manipulation magic. Usually resulting in him simply returning to your shoulder. + 31+: Meowsaton lounges on your shoulder and you are able to speak with him in Common. Any requests of him will depend on his mood and how you've treated him. Gain the effect Purring Cat when appropriate.
import.hiddenDescription: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver and a small cat toy dangling from it...

import.name: Orbous Insightous
import.description:
A small blue crystalline ball that can hold a spell for a creature's memory and improves their ability to see into the actions of others.

Adjusting the memorized spell requires a special ritual.
import.note:
Needs the knowledge:ritual:spellimbue knowledge entry to change the stored spell.

import.description: Listing of spells from the library that have been found for you to see.

Used to present spells found in the library.

import.name: Icy Presence
import.description: A frost enchanted necklace that makes your presence fairly known, but is ideal for the cold. Your body temperature is always stable and cool, in the arctic or a desert, but Fire & Cold damage still hurt, though cold much less. You also can not be set on fire or frozen. You have recently learned that this necklace once belonged to the King of an old kingdom called Hintobin. Formed after the fall of the ancient empires but fell more than a hundred years ago. In your search of the lore of this necklace, you learned that it has a connection to ancient officers of the law who would pursue criminals and that many had a necklace such as this and used it to help restrain their person's of interest. That ancient power is still within this necklace, though the ways to reach it seem lost to time. In witnessing the history of the necklace, you saw the King of Hintobin perform a powerful Fireball spell using ${6,orange}$ Red Power Crystals in a circular formation around his arm, seemingly aided by the necklace. As your vision progressed, you saw a rather large city seemingly wiped from existence by the spell before the lore of the necklace seemed to jump forward to it lost at sea before being picked up my merchants.
import.hiddenDescription: An icy white necklace that seems to emit a lite cool mist.

import.name: Bane
import.description: A charge may be used to curse a struck creature. If the creature is already cursed, it instead takes 3d8 Necrotic damage.

import.name: Bane
import.description: A charge may be used to curse a struck creature. If the creature is already cursed, it instead takes 3d8 Necrotic damage.

import.name: Bane's Accomplice
import.description: Allows the attuned to strike true and move cursed creatures. A charge may be consumed from this necklace and any creature suffering from Bane can be struck by 2d4 Force damage and moved up to 1d12 studs in a direction of your choice. To resist this movement, the target creature makes a Strength DC${10+str+con,orange}$ save. The damage is still suffered.

import.name: Serenity
import.description: Can be summoned to your hand as long as you are attuned to this item and within 200 studs of it. Any number of charges can be expelled for different effects: + ${2,orange}$ Charges: A recently fired arrow dips in temperature, dealing an additional 1d8 Cold damage after landing. + ${3,orange}$ Charges: Add your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$) to your attack roll before you know if the attack will land or not. + ${5,orange}$ Charges: Take another full attack around. Treat this as a normal attack action, incurring any relevant feats such as Extra Attack.

import.name: Fletchers Grace
import.description: You must be wielding a bow to use charges from these gloves. A charge may be used from these gloves in place of a charge from an attuned bow or quiver. Additionally, charges from these gloves may be used to reroll any Sleight of Hand check provided the last weapon used was a Bow.

import.name: Calamity's Draw
import.description: Only holds arrows that were created, not a source of infinite arrows. When attacking, you may use a charge from this quiver to attack with one of the arrows inside. This quiver adds 1d8 Fire damage to the arrow. If the attack hits, perform a Dexterity save DC${20-wis,orange}$. On success, you may pull another arrow from this quiver to attempt to attack again as part of the current Attack action. The recipe for creating arrows known to the quiver yields ${10+wis,orange}$ arrows for 1 gold via a Transmutation enchantment.

import.name: Sight's Repose
import.description: A charge may be used to re-roll an Attack or Perception check. As a Reaction, ${3,orange}$ charges may be used for a friendly creature within ${30,orange}$ studs to reroll their Attack. If an attack from you or a friendly creature strikes another creature within ${60,orange}$ studs of you, you may use your Reaction to perform a Perception check against a Stealth check from that creature and on success you may use a charge to cast Hunter's Mark on that creature without using a Spell Slot.

import.name: Liberatus
import.description: A custom piece of armor composed of Mithril and leather, enchanted to provide the most freedom of movement a protective garment can provide.

import.name: Liberatus
import.description: A custom piece of armor composed of Mithril and leather, enchanted to provide the most freedom of movement a protective garment can provide.

import.name: Sight Arrow
import.description: After firing, perform an Arcana DC${20-dex,orange}$ check. On success, you can see from the location of the arrow for ${1,orange}$ minute. This check can be performed immediately after firing to watch as the arrow flies through the air, to see from where it lands, or both. If fired into a creature, this arrow still damages as usual.

import.name: Tracking Arrow
import.description: Powerful divine magic is etched into this arrow head. Once fired, you know the location of the arrow as long as it is within ${100*wis,orange}$ studs of you. Once recovered, a creature (not necessarily you) must perform a Religion DC${20,orange}$ check to prepare the arrow to be used again. If fired into a creature, this arrow still damages as usual.

import.name: Ring of Focus
import.description: A seemingly simple silver band with runes etched inside the band. When performing an Attack or Skill Check, you may use a charge to add ${1,orange}$d4 to your roll. Only one charge can be used per roll. If rolling with Advantage or Disadvantage, this is added to the number that would be the result.

import.name: Restorative Potion
import.description: When consumed, you heal for 4d6 and gain 1d4 worth of Spell Slots.

import.name: Greater Restorative Potion
import.description: When consumed, you heal for 8d6 and gain 2d4 worth of Spell Slots.

import.name: Royal Cloak
import.description: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it.
import.hiddenDescription: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. Found in Hwand.

import.name: "Fresh" Detached Head
import.description:
Recovered from the castle's courtyard on Galdur.

Seemingly from a fresher corpse

import.name: "Decayed" Detached Skull
import.description:
Recovered from the castle's courtyard on Galdur.

Seemingly from an older corpse, no flesh resides on this skull.

import.name: Lime Power Crystal
import.description:
A familiar palm sized crystal with a lime glow.

When holding this crystal in your hand, you may make a DC${22-wis,darkorange}$ check against your ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Enchanter's Kit","class":"rs-orange"}$ skill to align the crystal with another color.
import.note:
${"content":"The Comformist","class":"rs-orange"}$

When holding this crystal in your hand, you may make a DC${22-wis,darkorange}$ check against your ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Enchanter's Kit","class":"rs-orange"}$ skill.

import.name: Alisco's Cello
import.description: Made of a smooth metal and bearing crystalline runes in its neck, this cello gives off a faint blue glow when held. Requires care and maintenance to keep her in tune. If played while out of tune, it would likely hurt the ears of everyone ear by. With a quick fret, an arcane tuned burst of sound can lash out at a creature, causing Sonic damage. If you're attuned to this cello and have it in both hands (or in one hand with the other hand free), you can play (or continue playing) a tune on this cello as a Bonus Action. However, you can not take a Move Action and play the instrument in the same round. Currently, you're aware of 3 short tunes that can be played: 1. Folk Tune: Advantage on Wisdom saves and History checks to all friendly creatures who can hear you. 2. Jazz Tune: Advantage on Persuasion checks to all friendly creatures who can hear you. 3. Rock Tune: Advantage on Attack rolls to all friendly creatures who can hear you. You may know other tunes with other effects, check your Knowledge to see. The headstock also seems to have a socket for a power crystal...

import.name: Badger Pelt Hat
import.description:
Small hat made from a badger pelt.

Grants enough warmth to keep you comfortable on colder days. May make you a bit warm in hotter places though.

import.name: The Sage's Night
import.description:
A work of fiction seemingly saved and translated from ancient times. It stands as a long and ancient tale of a powerful wizard's keep and his arcane studies of the nocturnal arts.

May take some time to read.

import.name: Corovi's Spellbook
import.description: A protective encoding doubles the number of inkwells needed to copy from this book and makes it unusable as a spellbook to anyone but the creator.

import.name: Barrel of Vocatus Brew
import.description: A strong traditional orcish brew.

import.name: Ring of Symphony
import.description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

import.name: Ring of Song
import.description: Charges scale with your Charisma Modifier (${cha, orange}$).

import.name: Ring of Symphony
import.description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

import.name: Alisco's Chains
import.description:
Resonating with the sounds of battle, these chains resonate with a humbling tune.

In combat, allies within ${12,orange}$ studs of you heal ${1,orange}$HP every round as long as they can hear.

Importantly, unconscious creatures are not considered able to hear.

import.name: Cor Vera
import.description: A corded belt that fortifies the essence of the creature to which it attunes. Once attuned, you gain ${6 * con,orange}$HP, scaling by ${6,orange}$ with your Constitution Modifier (${con,orange}$). Additionally, with the fortified soul, you gain damage reduction against Necrotic and Poison damage.

import.name: Alisco's Song Book
import.description: A book of Alisco's music, descriptions and rituals are written in Ancient.

import.name: Isikha Candle
import.description:
A candle that helps with time keeping, make from a complex and delicate alchemy process, though not terribly expensive.

When a charge is used, you can tell time for the next hour as long as you can see the candle.

import.name: Traveling Spice Rack
import.description: A comprehensive rack of spices, adds ${3 + wis,orange}$ (Scaling with Wisdom) to Alchemy Kit checks involving cooking. When using multiple spice racks, only add the largest bonus.

import.name: Ring Espiga
import.description: A ring honed for balancing the weight of daggers, it adjusts to the wearer to improve their skill. Any melee attack you perform with a dagger has a Critical Range is increased by ${1,orange}$. With no modifiers you deal critical damage on a ${20,orange}$, but with this ring you critical on a ${19,orange}$ instead. If another item gave a similar effect, you would then critical on an ${18,orange}$.

import.name: Amulet of Tongues
import.description:
Enchanted with the knowledge of a language scholar, this amulet allows the wearer to know other languages.

Whenever you regain consciousness, roll 1d12. You know the corresponding language below until your next long rest.

1. Sylvan
1. Druidic
1. Deep Speech
1. Giant
1. Draconic
1. Dwarvish
1. Elvish
1. Gnomish
1. Orc
1. Aquan
1. Infernal
1. Abyssal

import.name: Armor of Grace
import.description: Light leather armor, tight and well fit, this armor moves with you, mentally and physically, helping to protect you. When performing any Saving Throw, you have critical success on a ${19,orange}$ as well as a ${20,orange}$.

import.name: Ring Espiga
import.description: A ring honed for balancing the weight of daggers, it adjusts to the wearer to improve their skill. import.name: Proxio's Debate
import.description: Woven by an old wizard, Proxio. Often finding himself in debates with others who took offense to his logic, he fostered the creation of these robes to protect himself. When struck by a creature within ${10,orange}$ studs of you, perform a Persuasion check and reduce the damage by that much.

import.name: Proxio's Mandate
import.description: Woven by an old wizard, Proxio. These bracers help an able bodied spell caster to maintain their composure. As an Action, you can recover a single spell slot. You suffer 2d8 + 4 Necrotic damage per level of spell slot restored. For instance, a Level 1 slot can recovered by suffering 2d8 + 4. A Level 2 for 4d8 + 8, or a Level 4 for 8d8 + 16. Should you fall unconscious after use, you still have the spell slot on being revived. You can not recover a spell slot to which you do not have access.

import.name: Orison of Wisdom
import.description: A simple stone enchanted with a simple but powerful arcane circle.

import.name: Conduit of Strength
import.description: A simple stone enchanted with a simple but powerful arcane circle.

import.name: Finesse of Dexterity
import.description: A simple stone enchanted with a simple but powerful arcane circle.

import.name: Lesser Ring of the Arcane
import.description: A powerful ring crafted from a Blue Power Crystal and inscribed with inlaid golden runes, this ring grants the attuned an additional 5th Level spell slot.

import.name: Black Lotus
import.description: A unique flower, with a purple core surrounded by black petals and a black stem. Exceedingly rare and having only been found in extremely dangerous wilderness, no botanist has managed to grow the flower. When consumed, if you are able to cast spells, you regain ${3,orange}$ levels of Spell Slots limited by your maximum spell slot: + ${3,orange}$ 1st Level + ${1,orange}$ 1st & ${1,orange}$ 2nd Level + ${1,orange}$ 3rd Level If you are unable to cast spells, roll 1d4: You gain a Spell Slot of that level until you take a Long Rest or Short Rest. If the slot is unused when you rest, the latent arcane energy is released randomly while you rest.

import.name: Black Lotus Potion
import.description: A swirling and shimmering purple potion swirls in an enchanted crystalline sugar flask. Mean to be drunk, then the flask consumed. Once consumed, the consumer permanently gains a single 7th Level Spell Slot. While consuming the potion grants the slot, it does not instill the wisodm or knowledge to learn spells of that level itself. This potion does not cause you to be considered able to learn spells of the 7th Level.

import.name: Lesser Ring of the Arcane
import.description: A powerful ring crafted from a Blue Power Crystal and inscribed with inlaid golden runes, this ring grants the attuned an additional 5th Level spell slot.

import.name: Lesser Arcanic Band
import.description: A simple runic band that improves the power of the user's spells.

import.name: Enchantment: Ember's Embrace
import.description:
Adds "Ember's Embrace" enchantment to a weapon, giving it fire damage.

This counts as 2 enchantments once complete but imposes no additional risk when enchanting.

When applied to a wand, this has half its effect.

import.name: Enchantment: Dereliction
import.description: Adds "Dereliction" enchantment to a weapon, giving it cold damage and forcing a struck creature to pass a Constitution save or lose half their Movement speed. This counts as 2 enchantments once complete but imposes no additional risk when enchanting. When applied to a wand, only Cold spells receive the benefit.

import.name: Enchantment: Abandonment
import.description: Adds "Abandonment" enchantment to a weapon, forcing a struck creature to pass a Charisma DC${5 + cha}$ Save (Scales with your Charisma) or be Banished for the round. This counts as a Legendary enchantment once complete but imposes no additional risk when enchanting. When applied to a wand, this has no effect.

import.name: Leather Stamina Boots
import.description: A pair of simple leather boots sturdy enough to offer protection.

import.name: Lucy's Cauldron
import.description: A cauldron that can be placed somewhere to brew potions in bulk. On the outside of the cauldron is an elegant engraving, Lucy.
import.note: Specialty brewing item.

import.name: Ring of Symphony
import.description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

Only one charge can be used per roll. If rolling with Advantage or Disadvantage, this is added to the number that would be the result.

import.name: Ring of Focus
import.description: A seemingly simple silver band with runes etched inside the band. When performing an Attack or Skill Check, you may use a charge to add ${1,orange}$d4 to your roll. Only one charge can be used per roll. If rolling with Advantage or Disadvantage, this is added to the number that would be the result.

import.name: Greater Healing Potion
import.description: Possess magical properties from it's brewing that heal the creature that consumes the liquid.

import.name: Greater Ring of the Arcane
import.description: A powerful ring crafted from a Blue Power Crystal and inscribed with inlaid golden runes.

import.name: Dust of Shadows
import.description: When attuned, a charge worth of dust can be pulled from the pouch to cover a large or smaller creature and make it invisible as long as it does not move.

import.name: Amnesia Dust
import.description:
Dust slowly fills the pouch using the excess energy from the attuned creature.

When a creature is exposed to the dust, it must make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${8 + wis,orange}$ save or forget the last ${minute,orange}$ from its memory.

However the dust is difficult to handle and you may expose yourself to the dust. When used, make a ${Sleight,orange}$ ${of,orange}$ ${Hand,orange}$ DC${10-dex,orange}$ Skill Check, and on failure you also forget the last minute.

Any creature effected by forgetfulness has its memory restored when exposed to a Level ${3,orange}$ or higher healing spell.

import.name: Gate Dust
import.description:
Powerful runes adorn this pouch containing dust. The dust inside allows creatures to shift between planes.

Using ${1,orange}$ Charge can shift a single creature to the ${"content":"Ethereal Plane","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Using ${12/wis,orange}$ Charge(s) can shift a single creature to any Plane adjacent to the ${"content":"Ethereal Plane","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

import.name: Revealing Sands
import.description:
Can use a charge to pull a handful of dust from the pouch. The dust can cast on ${wis*wis,orange}$ Studs to reveal invisible creatures or any creatures in the ${"content":"Ethereal Plane","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

To be revealed, the dust must cover ${50%,orange}$ or more of the creature.

If the creature is in another plane, it still follows the usual rules of interaction.

import.name: Andiziyo
import.description:
Seemingly just the hilt of a blade. As you examine it, the hilt produces an energy like blade. A culmination of the souls of all the creatures its slain, the blade of this dagger is a long purple beam. The beam giving no resistance or weight, causing it to behave like a dagger instead of a swird.

At the beginning of combat, make a ${Constitution,orange}$ DC${20-level,orange}$ save. On failure, using this blade causes 1d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage with every strike as the blade drains your life force to power itself. Alternatively, a ${"content":"Red","class":"rs-red"}$ or ${"content":"Blue","class":"rs-blue"}$ ${"content":"Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ may be attached to the blade to satisfy the needs of the blade.

If a crystal is attached, roll 1d12 at the end of any combat. On a ${12,orange}$, the crystal shatters.

When a creature is slain by you, its life force is absorbed by this blade. This hilt is treated as the corpse of the dead for the purposes of things like ${"content":"Speak with the Dead","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ or ${"content":"Gentle Repose","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

When striking, charges can be expended from the hilt to various effects:
+ ${1,orange}$ Charge: Add ${1,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage
+ ${2,orange}$ Charges: If you've managed to hit, the hit is a critical hit
+ ${3,orange}$ Charges: Add ${3*wis,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage

If this blade is used while not attuned, the creature using the blade takes ${4,orange}$d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage for every attack.
import.hiddenDescription: A purple runic handle with runic symbols inlaid along the hilt.

import.name: Liberatus
import.description: A custom piece of armor composed of Mithril and leather, enchanted to provide the most freedom of movement a protective garment can provide.

import.name: Citol's Vitrol
import.description: Made of a smooth metal and bearing crystalline runes in its neck, this cello gives off a faint blue glow when held. With a quick fret, an arcane tuned burst of sound can lash out at a creature, causing Sonic damage, but can also be craftily played with both hands, lending an edge to the insults and verses that follow. However, this damage does not take if the target can not hear you.

import.name: Reckoning
import.description: A heavy scale-mail covers mythril chains, each scale careful engraved with golden runes. When you take damage from a melee attack, all hostile creatures within 6 studs of you take 2d6 Cold damage.

import.name: Amulet of Arcane Divinity
import.description: A powerful amulet bristling with power. When near, there is a noticeable increase in pressure in the room and its power is almost palpable. A tri-colored gem sits in the middle of this amulet; Orange, Lime, and Yellow. All glowing faintly in unison, particles near the stone seeming to vibrate and shimmer, giving it a particularly spectacular glow. A charge may be used construct an Arcane Orbital using 1 or more Power Crystals.

import.name: Amulet of Arcane Divinity
import.description: A powerful amulet bristling with power. When near, there is a noticeable increase in pressure in the room and its power is almost palpable. A tri-colored gem sits in the middle of this amulet; Orange, Lime, and Yellow. All glowing faintly in unison, particles near the stone seeming to vibrate and shimmer, giving it a particularly spectacular glow. A charge may be used construct an Arcane Orbital using 1 or more Power Crystals.

A tri-colored gem sits in the middle of this amulet; Orange, Lime, and Yellow. All glowing faintly in unison, particles near the stone seeming to vibrate and shimmer, giving it a particularly spectacular glow. A charge may be used construct an Arcane Orbital using 1 or more Power Crystals.

import.name: Bands of Resonance
import.description: With a magical instrument in hand, these bracers tune to the melody of the sounds around you. Whenever damage is dealt by Sonic damage, you may use a charge to increase or decrease that damage by 1d12. If your last action was not to play an instrument dealing Sonic, then using this charge costs a Bonus Action or Reaction. Only 1 charge may be used per instance of damage.

import.name: Sending Stone
import.description:
This stone can communicate with other sending stones to which it is connected.

The degree and distance of communication depends on the strength of connection.
import.note:
${25,orange}$DC ${Arcana,orange}$ to "hang up". Can still call in or out though.

${30,orange}$DC ${Arcana,orange}$ to somewhat "trace".

import.name: Mary Poppins
import.description: A thin finely crafted dagger with an ornate guard and a small charm hanging from the handle. When thrown, a charge can be used to perform a Performance check can be performed to attempt an attack on another creature within range of the last creature targeted. If the last creature struck was hit by a charged attack, the dagger will return to the owner.

import.name: Clone Blade
import.description: A heavy green blade that brings a mighty swing with it. A ghostly green shadow seems to closely follow the blade as it moves. When attacking, you may use a charge and a ghostly clone of the blade strikes out at the target. For the round, the attacked target suffers ${-5,orange}$ AC for until their turn. Only ${1,orange}$ charge may be used in this way per round. On a successful attack, you may also use 5 charges to double your rolled attack damage. If you criticalled on this attack, you double the result of the critical result, resulting in ${4x,orange}$ the rolled damage. Additionally, a subtle ghostly clone shadows you, granting you an additional Reaction.

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description: The <u>Light</u> of the crystals seems to <u>have</u> an effect on the beasts now, allowing them to pass through barriers without interfering with their alignments, which should indicate that they're stable...

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description: Of all the research I've done, of all the <u>Things</u> we've managed to achieve, the inherited crystalline properties is our greatest achievement. There's still stability to reach, but we're on our way.

import.name: Researcher's Note: Stabilizing Properties
import.description: <u>I am</u> certain we can achieve stable magical properties within the beast, but taming her is another direction entirely. We shall see what we can reach in the time we've been given, but I fear we may come up short...

import.name: Researcher's Note: Properties of Magic
import.description: While investigating <u>the</u> crystals <u>that all</u> compose the properties of magic in some way, we've strained our ability to contain the beasts. I'll be making some adjustments to hopefully improve this issue...

import.name: Detached Finger
import.description: Taken from a storage cabinet in a mysterious house in Graves End

import.name: Ring of Symphony
import.description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. import.name: Dissever
import.description: A large axe whose blade seems to lightly hiss, a caustic acid constantly coating the outside of the blade. When swung with one hand, it still bears some weight, but with both it is a formidable force. When wielded with both hands and striking an armored creature (Either natural armor such as Dragon Scales, or manufactured armor such as Leather Armor), a charge can be used to reduce the struck creatures Armor Class (AC) by your Strength modifier (${str, orange}$).
import.hiddenDescription: A large metallic great axe whose blade seems to hiss as if slowly dissolving but not diminishing.

import.name: Flaming Silvered Great Axe
import.description: A giant axe that can be wielded with both hands for additional force and silvered to cut through magical immunities but is still subject to armored reductions.

import.name: Coin of the Fifth Fleet
import.description: Seemingly inscribed into a Platinum Coin, this bears the insignia of the Draconian 5th Fleet,

import.name: Studded Leather Armor of Acid and Fire
import.description: A well constructed piece of leather serving as bodily protection.

import.name: Studded Leather Armor of Cold and Lightning
import.description: A well constructed piece of leather serving as bodily protection.

import.name: Studded Leather Armor of Protection
import.description: A well constructed piece of leather serving as bodily protection.

import.name: Intricate Chain Weave
import.description:
A tight weave of magically etched runic chain links help to protect the attuned.

A charge may be used to cancel an incoming critical hit.

import.name: Jewelry Box
import.description:
Originally trapped and found in Reykurax by the path of ascension.

Currently open.

import.name: Crate of Sorrow's Goods
import.description: Heavy crate of items from around the Path of Ascension. Enchanted with Divination and Abjuration magic. Is essentially undispellable and can only be opened by the owner. Whomever is opening the chest is Petrified by the magics on the chest, but only the most recent person to open the lid is petrified, unpetrifying the previous person, however they are briefly limp and could not continue to hold the chest open.

import.name: Liberatus
import.description: A custom piece of armor composed of Mithril and leather, enchanted to provide the most freedom of movement a protective garment can provide.

import.name: Serenity
import.description: Can be summoned to your hand as long as you are attuned to this item and within 200 studs of it. Any number of charges can be expelled for different effects: + ${2,orange}$ Charges: A recently fired arrow dips in temperature, dealing an additional 1d8 Cold damage after landing. + ${3,orange}$ Charges: Add your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$) to your attack roll before you know if the attack will land or not. + ${5,orange}$ Charges: Take another full attack around. Treat this as a normal attack action, incurring any relevant feats such as Extra Attack.

import.name: Calamity's Draw
import.description: Only holds arrows that were created, not a source of infinite arrows. When attacking, you may use a charge from this quiver to attack with one of the arrows inside. This quiver adds 1d8 Fire damage to the arrow. If the attack hits, perform a Dexterity save DC${20-wis,orange}$. On success, you may pull another arrow from this quiver to attempt to attack again as part of the current Attack action. The recipe for creating arrows known to the quiver yields ${10+wis,orange}$ arrows for 1 gold via a Transmutation enchantment.

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description: Master Crane stopped by to let us know that we have secured a piece of the original artifact which should help greatly with our experimentation. Though we have much progress to make with stabilizing the size of the creatures, that much energy may result in creatures too large to be of use.

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description:
Issues are continuing with their size, in some cases rampant growth after enchanting seems to come about at random, and others seem to burst into hundreds to thousands of smaller creatures.

We're trying to isolate the cause but this could be disastrous if unchecked.

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description: We've lost control of the creatures, I'm leaving this note for the members who come to continue our research. What follows is smeared in blood, partially written in ink, runic symbols seem to be the important part. Some of the runes seem to have been finished in blood... Examining the runes, you've made out that the runes outline an enchantment ritual, partially in Ancient.
import.note:
Imbues crystal power.

Can absorb a soul if mishandled.

import.name: Researcher's Note: Spider Inheritance
import.description: Of all the creatures tested, spiders seem to take to the enchantment the easiest, managing to also pass it down to their offspring fairly reliably.

import.name: Researcher's Note: Spider Heirarchy
import.description: <span class="rs-lightblue">No text seems to appear on this note, instead it seems to be a diagram with spiders at the top and various lines cascading down to different creatures occassionally looping back up to the spiders.
import.note: Intelligence or Animal Handling check to understand it is a predatory-prey diagram showing spiders as a food source and reinforcing their own enchanted natures by consuming the animals that eat them.

import.name: Researcher's Note: Crystalline Toxin Effects
import.description: Scribbled across the small piece of paper seem to be notes about toxic effects of bites from "Crystal Spiders"...
import.hiddenDescription: There seem to be some notes about various spider parts, but the handwriting is difficult to read...

import.name: Ornimentor
import.description: A specially crafted war hammer head shapes around Blue Power Crystals. Once a power crystal has been consumed, a special blue lattice forms in the middle of the war hammer's head piece and glows gently. After giving a power crystal to the war hammer, add a charge to this war hammer. If it already has a charge, the war hammer will not accept the new crystal. As long as there is a crystal present, 1 ally within ${30,orange}$ studs of you slowly regenerate Temporary HP at ${wis,orange}$HP per minute, up to ${10,orange}$ Temporary HP. If you land a critical strike on a creature, you may command the lattice to shatter. If you do, calculate the damage done from the critical and then deal that much Cold damage as well.
import.hiddenDescription: Large War Hammer with an interestingly constructed head piece.

import.name: Acidic Charm
import.description: A small light greenish charm . When you deal Acid damage, you may use a charge to double the rolled portion of the acidic damage.

import.name: Icy Charm
import.description: A small light bluish charm . When you deal Cold damage, you may use a charge to force a Constitution DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Freezing them for ${1,orange}$ round on failure.

import.name: Firey Charm
import.description: A small light orangish charm . When you deal Fire damage, you may use a charge to force a Dexterity DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Igniting them for ${5,orange}$ rounds on failure dealing 1d6 Fire damage at the start of their turn. The fire on the creature can be put out as an Action from any creature with an Intelligence above ${6,orange}$.

import.name: Force Charm
import.description: A small light bluish pink charm . When you deal Force damage, you may use a charge to force a Strength DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, pushing that creature 1d6 studs on failure in any direction.

import.name: Lightning Charm
import.description: A small light bluish charm . When you deal Lightning damage, you may use a charge to force a Constitution DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Paralyzing that creature for ${3,orange}$ rounds.

import.name: Necrosis Charm
import.description: A small light purplish charm. When you deal Necrotic damage, you may use a charge to force a Wisdom DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Cursing an attribute of that creature for ${2,orange}$ rounds. Attributes: + Strength + Dexterity + Constitution + Wisdom + Intelligence + Charisma

import.name: Poisonous Charm
import.description: A small light greenish charm. When you deal Poison damage, you may use a charge to force a Constitution DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Poisoning that creature for ${3,orange}$ rounds dealing 1d6 Poison damage at the start of their turn.

import.name: Glowing Charm
import.description: A small light white charm that has a slight glow to it. When you deal Radiant damage, you may use a charge to force a Intelligence DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Blinding that creature for ${3,orange}$ rounds on failure.

import.name: Thunderous Charm
import.description: A small blue charm that has a low drumming sound when held to the ear. When you deal Thunder damage, you may use a charge to force a Constitution DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Deafening that creature for ${3,orange}$ rounds on failure.

import.name: Psychic Charm
import.description: A small light bluish charm . When you deal Psychic damage, you may use a charge to force a Charisma DC${10+wis,orange}$ save, Charming them for ${3,orange}$ round on failure, causing them to treat you as an ally and friend. They retain memory of all action after the effect fades.

import.name: Vial of Elemental Flame
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.
import.note: x

import.name: Vial of Elemental Force
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

import.description:

import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.
