import.name: Vial of Elemental Psychosis
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

import.name: Vial of Elemental Light
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

import.name: Vial of Elemental Vitality
import.description:
Used for crafting, construction, or enchanting.

Alone, the elemental essence that is present in the vial has no effect if released and merely dissipates.

import.name: Researcher's Note
import.description: The Syndicate has informed us that we should expect interference from cultists on the continent. We suspect that some may currently be in Curell but we've heard nothing of any cultists being present there.
import.hiddenDescription: There seem to be some notes about various spider parts, but the handwriting is difficult to read...

import.name: See Journal: Researcher's Note: Resistances
import.description:
The Crystalline properties seem to result in the spiders acquiring a random set of resistances. Ironically the larger the size, the greater the number of resistances I observed, though the smaller spiders seem to be more capable of damage than the larger ones.

Small spiders seem to have 1 to 2 resistances while medium ones seem to always have 3, and a larger one seems to get up to 5 resistances.

Medium rolls until it has 3 unique resistances, where small and large merely roll 2 and 5 times respectively.

Resistance observed below (determined by 1d12):
1. Acid 
1. Cold 
1. Fire 
1. Force 
1. Holy 
1. Lightning 
1. Necrotic 
1. Poison 
1. Psychic 
1. Radiant 
1. Sonic 
1. Thunder
import.hiddenDescription: There seem to be some notes about various spider parts, but the handwriting is difficult to read...

import.name: See Journal: Researcher's Note: Instabilities
import.description: The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. On death, they seem to merely disperse, leaving no corpse. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. According to my measurements the detonation is as follows: [Spider Size Multiplier] * ( [Spider HP] + [Damage Received] ) Sizing Multiplier: + Small: 3 + Medium: 2 + Large: 1 The type of damage seems to follow the crystal being expressed, though I've only managed to craft a measurable experiment for Red and Blue properties, I hope to produce the same for Orange soon once we receive our shipment from the Caravan. + Red: Fire + Blue: Cold
import.hiddenDescription: There seem to be some notes about various spider parts, but the handwriting is difficult to read...

import.name: Potion of Bull's Strength
import.description: When consumed, you gain the effect of Bull's Strength for 1 hour, gaining carrying capacity and advantage on strength related Skill Checks. When consumed, you gain the Bull's Strength effect.

import.name: Platinum Coin
import.description: Holds the value of 100 gold coins, but does not sit in magical gold pouches well.

import.name: Vonderous
import.description: A finely crafted wand inlaid with golden crystal veins that surge with energy as you cast spells through it. When casting a spell through this wand that target a creature, you may warp that creatures mind for various effects: + ${1,orange}$ Charge: Deal an additional 2d12 Psychic damage in addition to the spells damage + ${2,orange}$ Charge: The creature performs a Constitution save against the damage taken or loses its next turn + ${4,orange}$ Charge: The creature loses all memory of anything that has happened since its last long rest + ${10,orange}$ Charge: The creature's Intelligence is set to ${0,orange}$ Does not apply anything additional to Area of Effect spells.

import.name: Wandering Dust
import.description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${40,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${40*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

import.name: Greater Ring of the Arcane
import.description: A powerful ring crafted from a Blue Power Crystal and inscribed with inlaid golden runes.

import.name: Gravesend Research Journal
import.description: --- # Sections --- Eldith managed to read the book while everyone else was training, revealing all the sections. + - About Resistances + - About Instability + - About Liquified Crystals + - About Spider Health + - About Spider Damage + - About Crystalline Glows --- # About Resistances --- The Crystalline properties seem to result in the spiders acquiring a random set of resistances. Ironically the larger the size, the greater the number of resistances I observed, though the smaller spiders seem to be more capable of damage than the larger ones. Small spiders seem to have 1 to 2 resistances while medium ones seem to always have 3, and a larger one seems to get up to 5 resistances. Medium rolls until it has 3 unique resistances, where small and large merely roll 2 and 5 times respectively. Resistance observed below (determined by 1d12): 1. Acid 1. Cold 1. Fire 1. Force 1. Holy 1. Lightning 1. Necrotic 1. Poison 1. Psychic 1. Radiant 1. Sonic 1. Thunder --- # About Instability --- The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. On death, they seem to merely disperse, leaving no corpse. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. According to my measurements the detonation is as follows: [Spider Size Multiplier] * ( [Spider HP] + [Damage Received] ) Sizing Multiplier: + Small: 3 + Medium: 2 + Large: 1 The type of damage seems to follow the crystal being expressed, though I've only managed to craft a measurable experiment for Red and Blue properties, I hope to produce the same for Orange soon once we receive our shipment from the Caravan. + Red: Fire + Blue: Cold --- # About Liquified Crystals --- We are running low on our supply of liquified crystals and will need a new shipment from the syndicate soon, I suspect it will cost some 100,000G to get it secured and safely to the lab. As I understand it, we are running low on our supply as a whole. The encyclopedias should have the information necessary for the liquification process as well as the rituals for combining the raw elements to create such vials as well. --- # About Spider Health --- Observing the spiders, they are quite hostile to other creatures and special containment has been necessary to allow us to study them effectively. Phasing them into an observable pocket dimension has proven useful as we are able to control what goes in and out, though the spiders do appear to weaken after a period inside the pocket dimension, even with adequate nutrient being pumped inside. What follows here-in is a ritual to create a controlled pocket dimension inside a simple cage. The enchantment seems to handle pumped air through the realm as well. Details on how to insert and remove objects appears to be detailed and extremely complicated, however seems to involve the use of 7th level spells. Under observation, the various sizes of the spiders seem to be proportional to their health. + Crystalline: 48 - 104 (40+8d8) + Small: 70 - 95 (65 + 5d6) + Medium: 105 - 130 (100 + 5d6) + Large: 125 - 150 (120 + 5d6) + Giant: 168 - 240 (160 + 8d10) + Monstrous: 320 - 500 (300 + 20d10) Unfortunately, we were not able to grow a crystalline spider much larger than a small one, but judging by the ferocity of its bite, we currently presume it to be more than enough. --- # About Spider Damage --- The damage the spiders can inflict from their mere fangs is as one would expect, the large the creature, the larger the fangs. However spiders towering over our larger ones seem more docile and are much slower. While I've witnessed them crush a panther to death and eat it whole, I'm not convinced a non-sedated panther could not kill one, or at least escape it. The larger ones and the smaller variants seem to possess the aggression we desire. Their base damage seems to be as follows (Ignoring stat bonuses and other effects imparted from their crystalline properties): + Large: 4d12 + Medium: 3d10 + Small: 2d8 The intriguing difference comes about their expression of their crystalline properties. Additionally, smaller creatures in all our experiments seemed to follow this rule so we expect similar results as we apply this to other creatures. Researching the Red Power Crystal effects, we observed the fang bites to have these properties: + Large: 1d8 Fire + Medium: 2d10 Fire + Small: 6d6 Fire As a special case, we were somewhat able to observe a Red Crystalline Spider but measurement proved problematic, however our highest measurement was ${68,orange}$: 11 Piercing and 57 Fire. All of that while still possessing the ability to poison a creature with its toxins. --- # About Crystalline Glows --- In allowing the crystalline spiders to breed, there seems to be a rare mutation that results in a seemingly White Glow accompanying its normal glow, giving them a lighter tint. I believe this is a spontaneous result in line with the text and rituals of the Divina Arcana, but without the text I can not confirm. Further research on these spiders may be a way to achieve parts of our goal without the Artifacts, but suspect this will take some time. I've arranged transport of half a dozen crystalline spiders that exhibit this glow to several other research outposts for further study. However be careful, they can appear docilie, but seem to be able to escape the dimensional cages if additional measurers aren't taken and refreshed periodically. The entry the continues with a set of arcane circles denoting a level 5 spel: Dimensional Containment
import.hiddenDescription: A research journal from Gravesend, appears to be written in Abyssal and seems to contain a number of notes and diagrams. May take some time to read and likely reveal some information. --- A research journal from Gravesend, appears to be written in Abyssal and seems to contain a number of notes and diagrams. Each section seems large enough to take a few hours to read and understand and a cursory check shows there appear to be several... --- Per Section: + ${5 - (dex/2), orange}$ Hours Reading, reduced by half your Dexterity modifier + Investigation Check DC${18,orange}$ to understand (Reduced by your Wisdom Modifier (${wis,orange}$) per failed check of that section) + Comprehension of Abyssal

Holy 1. Lightning 1. Necrotic 1. Poison 1. Psychic 1. Radiant 1. Sonic 1. Thunder --- # About Instability --- The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. As I understand it, we are running low on our supply as a whole. Phasing them into an observable pocket dimension has proven useful as we are able to control what goes in and out, though the spiders do appear to weaken after a period inside the pocket dimension, even with adequate nutrient being pumped inside. What follows here-in is a ritual to create a controlled pocket dimension inside a simple cage. The enchantment seems to handle pumped air through the realm as well. Details on how to insert and remove objects appears to be detailed and extremely complicated, however seems to involve the use of 7th level spells. Under observation, the various sizes of the spiders seem to be proportional to their health. + Crystalline: 48 - 104 (40+8d8) + Small: 70 - 95 (65 + 5d6) + Medium: 105 - 130 (100 + 5d6) + Large: 125 - 150 (120 + 5d6) + Giant: 168 - 240 (160 + 8d10) + Monstrous: 320 - 500 (300 + 20d10) Unfortunately, we were not able to grow a crystalline spider much larger than a small one, but judging by the ferocity of its bite, we currently presume it to be more than enough. --- # About Spider Damage --- The damage the spiders can inflict from their mere fangs is as one would expect, the large the creature, the larger the fangs. However spiders towering over our larger ones seem more docile and are much slower. While I've witnessed them crush a panther to death and eat it whole, I'm not convinced a non-sedated panther could not kill one, or at least escape it. The larger ones and the smaller variants seem to possess the aggression we desire. Their base damage seems to be as follows (Ignoring stat bonuses and other effects imparted from their crystalline properties): + Large: 4d12 + Medium: 3d10 + Small: 2d8 The intriguing difference comes about their expression of their crystalline properties. Additionally, smaller creatures in all our experiments seemed to follow this rule so we expect similar results as we apply this to other creatures. Researching the Red Power Crystal effects, we observed the fang bites to have these properties: + Large: 1d8 Fire + Medium: 2d10 Fire + Small: 6d6 Fire As a special case, we were somewhat able to observe a Red Crystalline Spider but measurement proved problematic, however our highest measurement was ${68,orange}$: 11 Piercing and 57 Fire. All of that while still possessing the ability to poison a creature with its toxins. --- # About Crystalline Glows --- In allowing the crystalline spiders to breed, there seems to be a rare mutation that results in a seemingly White Glow accompanying its normal glow, giving them a lighter tint. I believe this is a spontaneous result in line with the text and rituals of the Divina Arcana, but without the text I can not confirm. Further research on these spiders may be a way to achieve parts of our goal without the Artifacts, but suspect this will take some time. I've arranged transport of half a dozen crystalline spiders that exhibit this glow to several other research outposts for further study. However be careful, they can appear docilie, but seem to be able to escape the dimensional cages if additional measurers aren't taken and refreshed periodically. The entry the continues with a set of arcane circles denoting a level 5 spel: Dimensional Containment

import.name: Researcher's Skull
import.description: The skull of a researcher from Gravesend
import.note: Skull of Sius Onsaeg

import.name: Anulus Visius
import.description: Inlaid with finely carved runes of Blue Power Crystal, this ring protects the wearer from effects against their mind. A charge can be used to reroll a Charisma save or any of the below checks any number of times: + Persuasion + Deception + Performance

import.name: Anulus Medius
import.description: A magical ring inlaid with green crystalline runes. While injured in combat, you heal every round for 1d12 HP. Outside of combat, your blood slows, healing you for 1d12 every hour. As an Action, a charge can be used to heal yourself or any creature you are touching for 1d12.

import.name: Curellian Artifact
import.note: Composed of a raw ancient refined material

import.name: Stone Talisman
import.description: A simple stone talisman
import.note: Planted by Satheu during their fight

import.name: Curse Arrow
import.description: When a creature is struck by this arrow, it must pass a Constitution or become cursed.
import.hiddenDescription: A black arrow that feels cursed when touched.
import.note:
If handled by the shaft improperly, deals 2d12 Necrotic damage.

The curse slowly builds damage over time and damages when it expires or is dispelled.

import.name: Collected Reports of Curell
import.hiddenDescription: Seemingly used by the Meisters for reviewing if a person should receive the Mark of Curell.

import.name: Divine Offering
import.description: Make of a specially crafted hardened leather, this armor protects the wearer from death. If you die while wearing this armor and attuned, the armor is consumed and you revive with ${wis + 1,orange}$d6 Health (Scaling with your Wisdom modifier. Some limitations may apply.
import.hiddenDescription: A heavier than usual leather seems to compose this armor.

import.name: Heavy War Hammer
import.description: A heavy 2 handed hammer.

import.name: Heavy War Hammer
import.description: A heavy 2 handed hammer.

import.name: Guidance
import.description: A giant 2 handed sword enchanted for easier swinging.
import.hiddenDescription: Seemingly magical Great Sword

import.name: Unknown Leather Armor
import.hiddenDescription: Acquired on a boat under the falls in the path of ascension.

import.name: Rock Fort
import.description: + 1 Charge (+ 1 Reaction): Block a successful attack against you or an adjacent creature reducing all damage taken by 3d8. Can not reduce the damage below 0. + 3 Charges (+ 1 Action): Choose up to 3 creatures within 20 studs of you (Can include yourself) to receive the Fort Buff for 3 rounds. + 5 Charges (No Additional Cost): Bash a creature with the shield forcing a Constitution DC${5 + level,orange}$ save that stuns the struck creature for 1 Round on failure, leaving them unable to act on their turn that round.

import.name: Orc Felled War Hammer
import.description: A heavy war hammer with a signature Orcish design. Too top heavy to be wielded normally, Orcish smithing has taken to blindly enchanting their creations with chaotic dark magics to balance them.

import.name: Orc Felled War Sword
import.description: A heavy war hammer with a signature Orcish design. Too top heavy to be wielded normally, Orcish smithing has taken to blindly enchanting their creations with chaotic dark magics to balance them.

import.name: Divine Offering
import.description: Make of a specially crafted hardened leather, this armor protects the wearer from death. If you die while wearing this armor and attuned, the armor is consumed and you revive with ${wis + 1,orange}$d6 Health (Scaling with your Wisdom modifier. Some limitations may apply.
import.hiddenDescription: A heavier than usual leather seems to compose this armor.
import.note: When used to revive, you permanently lose 1 point of your choice from the following Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

import.name: Unknown Necklace
import.hiddenDescription: Necklace from an ornate shipwreck in Reykurax by the Path of Ascension.

import.name: Commune with Nature Tome
Bardic Heroism Sheet Music
Erellias Armor Tome
Erellias Scorcher Tome
Gaes Tome
Tribute of Daminoth
import.description: A necklace pendant in the shape of Daminoth, it currently has no chain. Seemingly belonged to a raving lunatic aboard the Ntanti.
import.hiddenDescription: A metallic mast cast in an odd shape:
import.note: Galvin Broadshore's necklace found in a temple to Daminoth that he believes helped him decipher Ancient.

import.name: Iphindawo
import.description: An old enchanted Elvish parchment of location. Once per day, a Wisdom save against this parchment and speak 1 word. The map reveals near-by locations of particular creatures or things based on the last spoken word and its interpretation there of. Range seems to be approximately ${5000,orange}$ studs but is subject to some natural and magical barriers. Once the map reaches any indicated point, the map turns off until the next day.
import.hiddenDescription: An old looking parchment that has a small glowing dot on it that seems to lie behind the barrier.
import.note:
+ Red Crystal: More damage against the tracked creature or object (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Blue: Tracks additional instances (Wis) (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Green: Reveal surrounding terrain (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Orange: (Consumes the Crystal) and Teleports the holder to the nearest occupiable space closest to the closest dot. 1 crystal per creature holding the scroll.

import.name: Book
import.hiddenDescription: A leather bound book that seems magically sealed and has no lock.

import.name: Kintarian Ritual Spear
import.description:
A ritual spear for combat, only used by seasoned warriors of the ${"content":"Kintari","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

When touched by non-Kintari, deals ${2,orange}$d10 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage.
import.note:
Attuning to this fills your mind with evil thoughts of greed, lust, and chaos.

Wisdom save DC20 to resist each day.

Previous Action Map:
{
    "action": [],
    "bonusAction": [],
    "reaction": []
}

import.name: Divine Offering
import.description: Make of a specially crafted hardened leather, this armor protects the wearer from death. If you die while wearing this armor and attuned, the armor is consumed and you revive with ${wis + 1,orange}$d6 Health (Scaling with your Wisdom modifier. When used to revive, you permanently lose 1 point of your choice from the following Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. Some limitations may apply.
import.hiddenDescription: A heavier than usual leather seems to compose this armor.
import.note: When used to revive, you permanently lose 1 point of your choice from the following Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

import.name: Kintarian Tower Shield
import.description:
A large shield seen only on the strongest of Kintari warriors.

Imparts ${str,orange}$AC to adjacent friendly creatures.

import.name: Kintarian High Spear
import.description:
A ritual spear for combat, only used by seasoned warriors of the ${"content":"Kintari","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

When touched by non-Kintari, deals ${10,orange}$d10 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage.
import.note:
Attuning to this fills your mind with evil thoughts of greed, lust, and chaos.

Wisdom save DC20 to resist each day.

import.name: Reusable Spell Ink
import.description:
A magical well of Spell Copying Ink that slowly recharges over time as you rest.

When copying a spell, a charge may be used instead of an inkwell, however each charge can only be used as 1 inkwell for the purposes of copying at any given time.

While rare to find, multiple of these inkwells maybe used at once and multiple can be carried by a single creature.

import.name: Recipe: Healing Potions
import.description: Minor, Major, Arcane Elixirs! A complete guide to the potion of healing and its properties. Spending time reading this book will allow you to slowly learn to brew Minor Healing Potions and slowly build to larger healing potions or faster brewing. In combination with other known recipes, healing properties may become available to weave into your brews as you learn to understand the fundamentals of healing.

import.name: Enchanting Guide: Usherance
import.description: A guide to the Usherance Enchantment. Contains detailed guides on the various arcane circles and sigils to enchant the weapons of the world with +1 to Attacks. Spending time reading this book will allow you to slowly learn to enchant objects with the Usherance enchantment, which counts as ${1,orange}$ enchantment level on the enchanted item and can be applied multiple times to the item. While this can be applied to any item, this is most commonly applied to weapons. If applied to a Jar of Pickles, the effect would be +1 to a Thrown Attack using that item.

import.name: Enchanting Guide: Refilling
import.description: A guide to the Refilling Enchantment. Contains detailed guides on the various arcane circles and sigils to bring you your favorite brew every time. Results may vary Spending time reading this book will allow you to slowly learn to enchant objects with the Refilling enchantment. As other enchantments are learned or additional magics understood, you may be able to vary this enchantment.

import.name: Ring of Symphony
import.description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

When touched by non-Kintari, deals ${6,orange}$d10 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage.
import.note:
Attuning to this fills your mind with evil thoughts of greed, lust, and chaos.

Wisdom save DC20 to resist each day.

import.name: Kintarian Tribal Shield
import.description: A lightweight large shield wielded by Kintari. While wielded, you can take an action to Defend a near-by creature, redirecting all damage from that creature to you. When touched by non-Kintari, deals ${6,orange}$d10 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage.

import.name: Warden Warrant
import.description: A warrant from the city of Curell for the retrieval, Alive or dead, of the person here-in.

import.name: [X] Warden Warrant: Bandit
import.description: A warrant from the city of Curell for the retrieval, Alive or dead, of the bandit here-in for ${100,orange}$G. Looking at the rendered illusion of the wanted Bandit, you recognize him as one of the bandits that attacked you on the path and that Ash turned into Larry Friendly.
import.note: Faman Umb

import.name: [C] Warden Warrant: Bandit - Rantej Umosian
import.description: A warrant from the city of Curell for the retrieval, Alive or dead, of the bandit here-in for ${100,orange}$G. The name for the Bandit turned out to be Rantej Umosian, a low level bandit mostly robbing passer-bys. This warrant has been stamped by an investigator in the Warden Garrison and should be retrievable the following morning provided the body passes inspection. And on Alucevum 7 you claimed ${100,orange}$G for handing in his remains from the Warden Garrison.

import.name: [C] Warden Warrant: Bandit - Fonyola?
import.description: A warrant from the city of Curell for the retrieval, Alive or dead, of the bandit here-in for ${300,orange}$G. Using scrying, Eldith caught a glimpse of a seeming assassin matching the likeness of the warrant. As she watched, the Tiefling seemed to talk with a shadow who received 1000G to finish some job on the southwestern part of the city. 2 horses in a red carriage. Handed in the body of the assassin in the morning of Alucevum 8.
import.note: Fonyola Usip

import.name: Letter: Night Correspondence
import.description: Letter of correspondence that was hidden on the windowsill in The Hoffle. Seems to be notes between two lovers writing back and forth on the same paper. Possibly evidence of an affair.

import.name: Necklace of Sight
import.description:
A seeming plain but magical necklace allows the creature wearing it to see 60 studs farther than usual with crystal clarity, their eyes able to focus that much farther into the distance at will.

Known to help with finding and tracking things should one have the skill to do so already.

import.name: Skeleton Key
import.description:
A magical shifting key, known to quite adept at opening locks, in some cases even magical ones. However, once used, they almost always break, even if the lock in question was already unlocked or was quite simple.

They do however require a lock on which to operate. If no keyhole exists or the keyhole is jammed with broken lockpicks from previous attempts, this key can not be used.

import.name: Filala's Head
import.description: The head of Filala's corpse. Last cast of talk with the dead: Alucevum 7, 319

import.name: Kintarian Sorcery book
Kintarian Sorcery book
Kintarian Sorcery book
Kintarian Sorcery book
Gimsteinn
import.description: A smooth and extremely well balanced, the blade is seemingly composed of nothing but the frost of air and the quilon formed from a blue power crystal, lending only more greatness to its balance. When struck by this blade, the frostly apparition that is the blade pierces almost all barriers and chills the victim. When thrown, the blade stays where it lands, but as long as the attuned maintains a free hand, on any Attack Action they can instead command the dagger to attack, from where it lay, any creature of which the attuned is reasonably aware. If the target of this special attack is further than ${200,orange}$ studs from you, this Attack Action is at disadvantage. If you can not see the creature but are aware of it, such as around a corner, then the target gets +5 Armor. This special Attack Action replaces the attack but still counts as an attack. So a Bonus Attack Action with a light weapon can still occur. If you have Extra Attack, this special action replaces only one of the Attack Actions. You also possess two special Actions to "move" the dagger. One to move the dagger to a special pocket dimension. Another to pull the dagger to your hand from the special pocket dimension. If you unattune from the dagger while it is in the pocket dimension, it appears at your feet.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate dagger with a blue crystalline quilon.

import.name: Eitur
import.description: A special dagger formed from Green Power Crystal adding a powerful Poison element to it's attacks.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate dagger with a green crystalline blade and quilon.

import.name: Lillum
import.description: A special dagger formed from a Red Power Crystal adding a powerful Radiant element to it's attacks.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate dagger with a red crystalline blade and hilt.

import.name: Proscio
import.description: A special dagger formed from a Blue Power Crystal granting improved accuracy and defense but its added weight impedes its throwing range.
import.hiddenDescription: An ornate dagger formed from a blue power crystal.

import.name: Frickiyzie
import.description:
Potent pills that cause you to see otherworldly things. Enjoyed by dropping the pills into a large cauldron and enjoying the sugary beverage that comes forth.

Known to be quite messy. Partially from boiling over. Partially from the intoxicated spilling their drinks.

The shop keeps always note that the pills expire after some time, causing them to have no effect.
import.hiddenDescription: Unknown effects
import.note: Created from liquified power crystals, Curell sits on enchanted land created by Durong (Crane Vox) and in Curell these pills show other beings in an adjacent plane. These pills have no effect outside of Curell, but their secretive nature and that of Curell keeps many from noticing and the few that do assume they have a "bad batch" or that the pills have "gone bad".

import.name: Rasping Blade
import.description: A hearty blade seeming coated in a dark shadow. When a creature takes Necrotic damage from this blade, the attuned creature heals for that much damage.
import.hiddenDescription: A haunting dark shadow follows the blade of this sword.
import.note: If wielded by someone who is not a devoted follower of Cthulhu, when healed this way, the user is slowly corrupted gaining 1 point of corruption per point healed. If the corruption reaches the max hp of the user they are cursed and can no longer heal dying over 3 rounds after which their corpse is animated and turned into a servant of Cthulhu. Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

import.name: Dust of Tracelessness
import.description: When attuned, a charge worth of dust be used to cover 64 studs worth of food prints.

import.name: Dust of Tracelessness

import.name: Dust of Tracelessness
import.description: When attuned, a charge worth of dust be used to cover 64 studs worth of food prints.

import.name: Dust of Shadows
import.description: When attuned, a charge worth of dust can be pulled from the pouch to cover a large or smaller creature and make it invisible as long as it does not move.

import.name: Dust of Shadows
import.description: When attuned, a charge worth of dust can be pulled from the pouch to cover a large or smaller creature and make it invisible as long as it does not move.

import.description: When attuned, a charge worth of dust can be pulled from the pouch to cover a large or smaller creature and make it invisible as long as it does not move.

import.name: Vinyespa Blade
import.description: The blade of this sword is covered in living thorns. As part of your Attack Action you may spend a charge causing the thorns to lash out to ${30,orange}$ studs to strike your target. When a charge is used, this weapon also gains 2d8 Poison damage.

import.name: Hidden Blade
import.description: Bracers with a hidden dagger stored inside. As part of any Melee Attack Action you may use a charge to additionally attack with these bracers for 1d6 Piercing if the attack hits. If you have Advantage on the Attack Roll and manage to hit, you may roll a second attack with the weapons bonuses and on hit the blade instead deals ${dex,orange}$d6 Piercing damage (Scaling with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$). Max charges scale with your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$).

import.name: Vinyespa Blade
import.description: The blade of this sword is covered in living thorns. As part of your Attack Action you may spend a charge causing the thorns to lash out to ${30,orange}$ studs to strike your target. When a charge is used, this weapon also gains 2d8 Poison damage.

import.name: Flask of Blood
import.description: A sturdy flask for mixing chemicals.

import.name: Lightning Cella Armor
import.description:
Cella Leather armor is a special leather armor that offers protection against those who would harm you.

This armor protects against poison damage.

import.name: Rasping Blade
import.description: A hearty blade seeming coated in a dark shadow. When a creature takes Necrotic damage from this blade, the attuned creature heals for that much damage.
import.hiddenDescription: A haunting dark shadow follows the blade of this sword.
import.note: If wielded by someone who is not a devoted follower of Cthulhu, when healed this way, the user is slowly corrupted gaining 1 point of corruption per point healed. If the corruption reaches the max hp of the user they are cursed and can no longer heal dying over 3 rounds after which their corpse is animated and turned into a servant of Cthulhu. Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

import.name: Wallmaker
import.description: Seemingly simple heavy plate armor enchanted with protection magic. A charge may be used to instantly construct a ${10,orange}$ stud wide, ${5,orange}$ stud high, ${1,orange}$ stud thick wall centered on you up to 5 studs away and can not intersect with a creature (alive or dead). Any number of charges can be used at once to construct a wall with additional length, height, or thickness. The wall is considered magical and persists for ${con,orange}$ minutes. Once constructed, you are not able to dismiss the wall though Dispel Magic and similar effects will instantly remove it. If the wall intersects with prexisting terrain, buildings, or other features it stops at them either meeting flush with them to finish its construction or stopping at them depending on the nature of the impediment. Max charges scale with your Constitution modifier (${con,orange}$).

import.name: Feathered Boots
import.description: Enchanted boots that weigh as much as a feather. Once attuned, you take 1d8 less damage from falling and can use a charge to gain the effect Feather Fall for ${6,orange}$ seconds. Max charges scale with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$).

import.name: Windows
import.description: Azure colored gloves that shimmer in the pressence of magic. A charge can be used to cast Dispel Magic at level ${3,orange}$ on any barrier or to create a Window in any wall that is 1 stud thick or less. If the dispel fails or the wall is to thick, there is no effect and no additional evidence as to why the effect failed. Max charges scale with your Intelligence modifier (${int,orange}$).

import.name: Googler
import.description: A divine charm that helps the user find information. While inside any building you may ask the charm 1 question, composed of 1 sentence, no longer than 10 words. The charm then shines brightly for a 6 seconds before instilling your mind with an answer. Covering or obscuring the light causes the charm to fail to find an answer. Max charges scale with your Wisdom modifier (${int,orange}$).

import.name: Vocatus Stein
import.description: A strong traditional orcish brew. The flavor is off putting but the taste of nigh pure alcohol is quite likely to get you drunk. On a failed Constitution save, you take 1d6 Necrotic damage.

import.name: Blessed Vocatus Stein
import.description: An enchanted version of a strong traditional orcish brew. The flavor has a unique off putting initial taste but has a unique deep chocolatey after taste that can be quite pleasant. On a failed Constitution save, you take 1d8 Necrotic damage and heal 1d8 damage.

import.name: Vocatus
import.description: A strong traditional orcish brew.

import.name: Amazonia
import.description: A zesty azure colored hard liquor.

import.name: Milaje
import.description: A smokey purplish colored hard liquor that tastes of wood fired cherries.

import.name: Luminous
import.description: A blue wine with a citrusy berry flavor.

import.name: Jubilee
import.description: A green wine with a bitter earthy flavor with hints of sweet and savory tones.

import.name: Kindled
import.description: A dry red wine with a deep, sweet, strawberry and cherry flavor.

import.name: Render's Chakram
import.description: A little known but complex weapon. Can be thrown very accurately at short distances or simply used similar to a dagger. Works the same in main hand or off hand. When attacking, you may choose up to 3 targets and the order in which they will be struck. Each must be within range of the weapon from the last struck creature. These must be chosen before your attack is made. Additionally, any charges to be used must be chosen before attacks are made as well. Once you've chosen your attacks, make your Attack roll. On success, the Chakram hits and heads toward the next target or returns to you. On failure, the creature that was struck can make a Dexterity save against your Attack roll, and on success catches the Chakram. A critical failure on your Attack roll results in the Chakram falling to the ground at the target. If you fail 2 hits in a row, the Chakram flies off in a random direction. If the direction is towards you, it is not considered catchable. A single failure in a thrown attack results in the Chakram returning but requiring a Dexterity save to catch, with DC 10 * [Number of targets]. If the save is failed, you take the weapon's damage and it falls to your feet. When a creature is struck by this Chakrum, it must make a Constitution save at 36 / ( 1 + [Number of Targets]), and on failure receive the Bleeding effect and bleed for 1d6 Slashing damage per round until a save is successful or until healed.

If the save is failed, you take the weapon's damage and it falls to your feet.

import.name: Disarming Gloves
import.description: Made of enchanted leather, the gloves are resistant to damage and may be used a few times a day to attempt to disarm an attacker using a weapon that is ${8,orange}$ blocks in size or smaller. On a failed Attack against you, you may make a Sleight of Hand roll against the Attack roll and on success, the attacker's weapon is thrown to the ground. If you have a free hand, you may instead opt to take the weapon into your free hand if the weapon is usable in that situation. As a limited set of examples, an offhand weapon must be 6 blocks or smaller, or if the weapon would cause you to exceed your carry capacity. More cases exist. The maximum number of charges scales with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$).

import.name: Rasping Blade (NPC)
import.description: A hearty blade seeming coated in a dark shadow. When a creature takes Necrotic damage from this blade, the attuned creature heals for that much damage.
import.hiddenDescription: A haunting dark shadow follows the blade of this sword.
import.note: If wielded by someone who is not a devoted follower of Cthulhu, when healed this way, the user is slowly corrupted gaining 1 point of corruption per point healed. If the corruption reaches the max hp of the user they are cursed and can no longer heal dying over 3 rounds after which their corpse is animated and turned into a servant of Cthulhu. Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

import.name: Armor of Grace (NPC)
import.description: Light leather armor, tight and well fit, this armor moves with you, mentally and physically, helping to protect you. When performing any Saving Throw, you have critical success on a ${19,orange}$ as well as a ${20,orange}$.

import.name: Rusting Blade
import.description: Small specs of green liquid appear as if condensation against the blade, evaporating before dripping to anywhere. When a creature takes Acid damage from this blade, its Max HP is reduced by that much until their next long rest.
import.hiddenDescription: Small specs of green liquid appear as if condensation against the blade, evaporating before dripping to anywhere.

import.name: Rusting Blade (NPC)
import.description: Small specs of green liquid appear as if condensation against the blade, evaporating before dripping to anywhere. When a creature takes Acid damage from this blade, its Max HP is reduced by that much until their next long rest.
import.hiddenDescription: Small specs of green liquid appear as if condensation against the blade, evaporating before dripping to anywhere.

import.name: Steeping Blade
import.description: The blade of this sword is seemingly always covered in condensation. When a creature takes Cold damage from this blade, its next Attack roll is reduced by that much. Successive strikes from this blade (or similar effects) are cummulative.
import.hiddenDescription: The blade seems to be constantly coated in condensation.

import.name: Steeping Blade (NPC)
import.description: The blade of this sword is seemingly always covered in condensation. When a creature takes Cold damage from this blade, its next Attack roll is reduced by that much. Successive strikes from this blade (or similar effects) are cummulative.
import.hiddenDescription: The blade seems to be constantly coated in condensation.

import.name: Sweeping Blade
import.description: The weight of this blade aids in inflicting more damage.
import.hiddenDescription: A dark heavy blade.

import.name: Head of Omoyo Zenic
import.description: [ Last Spoken to on Alucevum 8, 319 ] After dying while chauffering Mrs. Dinoir from the city of Curell, his body was later collected after bing found invisible hidden in bushes near the side of the road. After being taken back to the warden Garrison, the party was able to pick his bodyout from the still invisible corpses thanks to talking to Mrs. Dinoir and asked him some questions after severing his head so that they could use Speak with the Dead and ask some additional questions later. Questions from Alucevum 8, 319: + Have you ever seen or heard of a snake/humanoid hybrid? No, cant say that I have + What do you remember before you passed away? Trying to get Mrs. Dinoir to safety + Do you know who the investigators Mrs. Dinoir hired? Athis and Cesis + Was there anything unusual about the carriage you drove yesterday? Nope, handled just fine + Do you know anything about a powerful invisibility spell? No, dont know much about it
import.note: Decapitated on Alucevum 8, 319

import.name: Crosswind
import.description: A small and lightweight bow magically reinforced to give it more power and range. Any number of charges can be used in one turn and the charges scale with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$): + 1 Charge: Add 1d10 Lightning Damage + 2 Charges: On an Attack Action, take an additional shot + 4 Charges: [ Must use before your Attack Roll ] Your next fired arrow deals double its rolled damage if it hits (This may be used multiple times in one turn between shots.) + 6 Charges: A strong breeze follows you and your attacks. You gain ${dex,orange}$ additional movement and deal an additional ${dex,orange}$ Piercing damage on successful attacks. These scale with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$).

import.name: Shadows of Curell
import.description: A dark painting of Curell with a sole streetlamp. The subtly of the dark paints used to create the shadowed buildings is quite masterful.

import.name: The Dead French Ladies
import.description: A beautiful and vibrant piece that is skeletons posed like models.
import.note: Medium worth artwork

import.name: Beer.
import.description: A wonderfully talented and detailed picture of a lone barrel of beer against a wood wall with the word "BEER" on the side of the barrel.
import.note: Low worth artwork

import.name: Enchanted Key
import.description: A bone carved key laced with dozens of complex magical enchantments.
import.hiddenDescription: This key seems to have been carved from a bone of some kind
import.note:
Name: Nephio's phylactery
Type: phylactery

Perception: 30+ or Arcana 20+ on Identify to determine it is a phylactery instead of a key.

import.name: Enchanted Key
import.description: A bone carved key laced with dozens of complex magical enchantments.
import.hiddenDescription: This key seems to have been carved from a bone of some kind
import.note:
Name: Nephio's phylactery
Type: phylactery

Perception: 30+ or Arcana 20+ on Identify to determine it is a phylactery instead of a key.

Currently in northern lunderipio

import.name: Robes of the Martial
import.description: These lively animated robes flow with the tides of battle. Any number of charges may be used as part of an Attack Action or Reaction: + ${1,orange}$ Charge: Increase your Attack Roll by ${1,orange}$ + ${2,orange}$ Charges: Decease your target's Armor by ${1,orange}$ + ${4,orange}$ Charges: On a successful strike, Attack Actions against the target for the rest of the round have Advantage. Max charges scale with your Constitution modifier (${con,orange}$).

import.name: Wind Step
import.description: Enchanted with the winds. Once attuned, these boots can summon the wind beneath your feet thick enough for you to step off of, effectively allowing you to jump again. This effect however is difficult to control. The wind can be summoned 10 times in a row before they need 1 round to recharge. However, each jump requires a Dexterity save. A charge can be used in lieu of a Dexterity save. Maximum number of charges scales with your Wisdom modifier (${wis,orange}$).

import.name: Investigators
import.description: A thin silver frame holds these enchanted lenses in place, small golden inlaid runes at the very bottom of each. When attuned with the glasses, you gain a slight bonus to Investigation and Perception as well as immunity to Blindness. While attuned, you may also use charges throughout the day: + ${1,orange}$ Charge: Name an object you know of and can picture in your mind. If an object matching that object is within 30 studs of you and in the same room, you are able to see a faint golden trail that will lead you to it. Does not work outside. + ${2,orange}$ Charges: Re-roll any Investigation or Perception check that reasonably involve the use of sight + ${4,orange}$ Charges: You gain the ability to see through a wall no thicker than 3 studs for 1 minute + ${8,orange}$ Charges: You critically succeed your Investigation check. This may be used after you have made the roll, but must be before you know if you have succeeded. Maximum number of charges scales with your Charisma modifier (${cha, orange}$) and use of these glasses constitutes use of Divination magic.

import.name: Carrec Bread
import.description: An extremely expensive delicacy for the non-adventurer, know for it's unique and delicious sweet & spicy taste as well as bringing renewed energy to its consumer. Once consumed, add ${1,orange}$ charge to any item to which you are Attuned or to one Feat.

import.name: Alchemy Recipe: Carrec Bread
import.description: Allows one to bake Carrec Bread. An extremely old recipe. However, the process is quite finicky and the recipe on this scroll lists the several dozen ways the process can go wrong and how to account for it, making this scroll required for those new to making the delicacy. However due to this finickiness and the sheer cost of materials to make it and its very limited use to the everyday person, the bread has fallen to the wayside of things made in the modern world. --- Carrec Bread: An extremely expensive delicacy for the non-adventurer, know for it's unique and delicious sweet & spicy taste as well as bringing renewed energy to its consumer. Once consumed, add ${1,orange}$ charge to any item to which you are Attuned or to one Feat. ---

import.name: Vyfu's Spellbook
Amulet of Arcane Divinity
import.description: A powerful amulet bristling with power. When near, there is a noticeable increase in pressure in the room and its power is almost palpable. A tri-colored gem sits in the middle of this amulet; Orange, Lime, and Yellow. All glowing faintly in unison, particles near the stone seeming to vibrate and shimmer, giving it a particularly spectacular glow. A charge may be used construct an Arcane Orbital using 1 or more Power Crystals.

import.name: Arrow
import.description: A simple arrow to deal damage with a bow.

import.name: Rope
import.description: Each charge represents 1 stud of rope.

import.name: Cake
import.description: A tasty treat that when consumed grants 1 Temporary HP and possibly other whimsical effects. If 3 are consumed within an hour, you gain the Stuffed effect, giving disadvantage on Constitution saves. Consuming too many may have nauseating effects.

import.name: Blessing of Cthulhu
import.description: An artifact blessed by Cthulhu for his priests to carry while manifested in other realms. A single charge can used as an Action or a Reaction to move one effect from one creature to another. If the effect was created by a level ${7,orange}$ spell or higher, you must make a Charisma save against the original caster's spell DC unless a power crystal is channeled with this blessing. If you are a Priest of Cthulhu, a charge can be used at anytime to instill chaos on the battle field. Roll 1d100 to pull energy from Skapari, the realm of discord. If you are not a Priest of the God of Chaos, then this effect triggers randomly.
import.note:
+ 1-15: Random explosions on the battle field for 3d6 Fire Damage
+ 16-33: 1d6 creatures swap positions
+ 34-56: All saves are inverted (Fails are saves and saves are fails). You have disadvantage on all Saves.
+ 57-84: AC is inverted. All attacks against you are at advantage.
+ 85-99: Pools of Liquid Power Crystal span randomly.
+ 100: All beneficial buffs for your foes that are not divine or infused with Power Crystals are nullified

import.name: Amulet of Arcane Divinity
import.description: A powerful amulet bristling with power. When near, there is a noticeable increase in pressure in the room and its power is almost palpable. A tri-colored gem sits in the middle of this amulet; Orange, Lime, and Yellow. All glowing faintly in unison, particles near the stone seeming to vibrate and shimmer, giving it a particularly spectacular glow. A charge may be used construct an Arcane Orbital using 1 or more Power Crystals.
